title: Lead QA Engineer
description:
Bragi was founded in 2013 and launched the world's first Truly Wireless Earphones in 2015 (yes, a whole 12 months before the Airpods...)

Since then, We have evolved from a promising startup to a market-moving creator of innovative technology, opening the new category of Truly Wireless Earphones. Bragi transformed into a software enabler for consumer brands, focusing on scaling its technology after investing more than $90 million in software and AI.

Now we are a leader in the AI headphone space, known for our smart devices that integrate seamlessly into users' lives. With a focus on innovation and user experience, we are driving the evolution of wearable technology

Lead QA Engineer

This is a remote role but you are welcome to join us in the Munich office

For this role you will work as the Lead Engineer for Bragi's manual testing domain

Tasks

  • Be the technical domain owner for firmware and system software validation, ensuring consistency, efficiency, and best practices across all QA activities
  • Define and maintain the QA Domain Roadmap in alignment with the Head of QA
  • Promote and ensure that common methodologies, processes, documentation standards and QA tools are applied across all teams
  • Mentor QA engineers and Embedded tech leads in test strategy, firmware validation, and integration testing
  • Develop test concepts for external partners, reporting format to Bragi
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to align QA practices with product and architecture roadmaps
  • Provide technical guidance on complex validation topics including firmware-app integration, audio validation, and embedded system testing
  • Support hiring, onboarding, and performance reviews by advising the Head of QA on technical competencies
  • Participate in customer or stakeholder meetings as a QA technical representative when required

Requirements

  • 7+ years of QA experience, including at least 2 years in a lead, senior, or technical leadership role
  • Strong experience in system validation, including firmware validation, hardware-software integration, and working with devboards
  • Proven ability to define test strategies, validation plans, and align them with UX specifications, requirements, and standards, in collaboration with the Head of QA
  • Ability to mentor QA engineers, fostering knowledge sharing and skill development across teams, in collaboration with the Head of QA
  • Proficient in both manual and test automation (PyTest, Appium)
  • Knowledge of CI/CD pipeline integration for QA processes
  • Experience with API testing tools (e.g., Postman) and manual validation workflows

Benefits

  • A project that is extremely technically challenging and will change how audio is consumed forever
  • A chance to deliver a delightful experience to 25m+ users in the next 12 months (existing base is 10m+)
  • A flexible online Learning & Development program: choose where you want to improve yourself
  • 10 professional coaching sessions with experts to support your growth
  • If you are in Munich and want to come to the office we have the usual start-up goodies (breakfast, lunch, beers, quizzes) and all sorts of digital fun if you are remote
  • Work from where suits you best with flexible working hours

description:
üöÄ Become our new Lead Full-Stack Software Engineer (m/f/d)

As a Lead Full-Stack Software Engineer, you will design, develop and maintain full-cycle applications (front-end to back-end) with AI/LLM integrations. You will work closely with product, data science, DevOps and cloud teams to build scalable, resilient systems that deliver value. You will help shape architecture, mentor others, and enable a culture of engineering excellence.

Your Responsibilities

  • Develop rich, interactive front-end applications using React.js that are performant, maintainable and user-friendly.

  • Build back-end services in either .NET (C#) or FastAPI (Python), ensuring clean APIs, business logic and data flows.

  • Deploy and operate in the cloud (preferably Microsoft Azure) ‚Äî including infrastructure as code, DevOps/CI-CD pipelines, and monitoring.

  • Work in the DevOps domain: define and implement CI/CD pipelines, use tools such as Azure DevOps, Terraform, automated testing, infrastructure automation.

  • Integrate AI / LLM capabilities (chatbots, embedding search, generative features) into the full-stack product.

  • Ensure solutions are scalable, performant, secure and maintainable.

  • Mentor junior team members, review code, and contribute to best practices and architectural discussions.

  • Stay up-to-date with the latest in cloud, full-stack and AI/LLM trends and help evaluate how they can be leveraged in our environment.



What You Bring to the Table

  • Several years (ideally 5 +) of full-stack engineering experience with production systems.

  • Strong front-end skills: React.js state management, component design and user-centric interfaces.

  • Back-end proficiency in either .NET (C#) or Python (FastAPI) ‚Äì writing clean, well-tested, performant APIs.

  • Experience with cloud environments (Azure preferred) and knowledge of its services.

  • Solid DevOps experience: CI/CD pipelines, IaC (Terraform or similar), pipeline automation, monitoring and logging.

  • Hands-on experience or strong interest in AI/LLM integration: leveraging models, embedding search, conversational interfaces or generative features.

  • You enjoy collaborating, presenting ideas, interacting across teams, helping others learn.

  • Excellent problem-solving mindset; you take ownership from design through deployment.

  • Good communication skills in English.

Why Join Us?

  • Work on exciting full-stack + AI-enabled products where you‚Äôll have real impact.

  • A collaborative, open culture that values innovation, learning and teamwork.

  • Opportunity to grow: mentor others, shape architecture, drive technical strategy.

  • Flexible working model (remote/hybrid), modern tech stack, investment in your development.

  • Join a team of passionate engineers, data scientists and product thinkers ‚Äî where AI isn‚Äôt just a buzzword, but part of the solution.

About KI performance

We are transforming the way companies work with data, preparing them for the future of AI. With our expertise in developing data platforms and AI-powered solutions, we create measurable value - always with a clear focus on business and strategy. Our projects range from global data platforms to innovative Gen AI applications, making a direct impact on the success of leading DAX companies. By leveraging cutting-edge technologies, we set new standards in digital transformation and work closely with Microsoft, Databricks, and our KI group ecosystem to develop sustainable and future-proof solutions.

Our company culture is shaped by forward-thinking, curious, and open-minded individuals who actively drive digital change. title: AI / LLM Engineering (Werkstudent)
description:
About the job

CognitX AI GmbHis building a privacy-first AI advisor for data analytics. We let people ask complex questions about their data in natural language and get trustworthy
answers, visualizations, and automated actions. Our architecture connects directly to enterprise sources, leverages a knowledge graph for context, and executes analyses through a secure compute layer. On-prem and cloud deployments are first-class.

The Role

As a Working Student in AI/LLM Engineering, you‚Äôll help design, build, and evaluate Agentic AI systems that turn questions into reliable analytics and automated workflows. You‚Äôll work across model prompting/tool-use, data access, and evaluation, collaborating closely with our founders on real enterprise use cases.

What you‚Äôll do:

  • Build and improve agentic workflows (tool/function calling, planning, self-checks) for analytics, summaries, and visualizations, task automation.
  • Implement adapters/tools to connect LLMs with internal and external services.

  • Develop evaluation metrics to measure accuracy, latency, and cost.
  • Optimize prompts, retrieval/contexting, and execution strategies for privacy, reliability, and performance.
  • Ship in containers (Docker) and collaborate on deploys (Kubernetes), CI, and observability.
  • Document decisions and share learnings with the team.

Requirements

What you bring:

  • Experience with LLMs/AI agents (function/tool calling, RAG, MCP, or agent frameworks) and Machine Learning fundamentals.
  • Strong Python skills for production code and data work (typing, tests, packaging).
  • Familiarity with APIs and microservices (FastAPI preferred), Git, and containerized dev (Docker).
  • Solid problem-solving, clear communication, and a proactive, ownership mindset.
  • Currently enrolled in Computer Science, Data Science, AI, or a related field (eligible to work as a Werkstudent:in).

Nice to have:

  • Retrieval/RAG stacks (embeddings, chunking, evaluators), Redis, PostgreSQL.
  • Kubernetes, GitLab CI, observability (logs/metrics/traces).
  • React/TypeScript for light UI tooling.
  • Interest in EU privacy/GDPR and safety-by-design for enterprise AI.
  • Exposure to self-hosted/open models (e.g., Llama, Mistral etc) and model serving.
  • Knowledge-graph concepts; graph queries.

Benefits

Why CognitX

  • Work on meaningful, privacy-first AI with real enterprise pilots.
  • Learn fast with tight mentorship from a team of Senior AI Experts.
  • Flexible hours, remote-friendly, and impact from day one.
  • Competitive Werkstudent compensation.

  • Let‚Äôs Glow! Enjoy 40% off our entire product range ‚Äì yes, everything.
  • Take a break ‚Äì you‚Äôve earned it. 30 vacation days + 1 personal holiday + up to 10 additional unpaid days off when you need a real reset. Oh, and New Year‚Äôs Eve? That‚Äôs a day off too!
  • Stay healthy, stay glowing. Our company health insurance reimburses up to ‚Ç¨600 per year for extras like vision aids, alternative medicine, or dental cleanings.
  • Thinking ahead. After your probation period, we‚Äôll contribute ‚Ç¨600 toward your pension plan ‚Äì and if you add more, we‚Äôll top it up with an extra 20%.

title: Staff Product Manager - Marketing Tech / User Acquisition (Web) (f/m/x)
description:
bonial helps you save time, money and paper!

We are a digital advertising partner for offline businesses - we support retailers in their marketing activities and help them find a new audience. Would you like to join and be a part of digitalisation of retail?

Bonial is part of Axel Springer SE and is disrupting the retail landscape as the leading "Drive to Store" partner in Germany and France. Through our platforms "kaufDA" and "MeinProspekt" in Germany, and ‚ÄúBonial‚Äù in France, we connect millions of users with their favorite shops and brands‚Äîdriving real impact every single day.
We are in the midst of an exciting growth phase, scaling fast and transforming the way people discover retail. At Bonial, we thrive in a high-performance, fast-paced environment fueled by motivated, results-driven individuals who are passionate about making a difference. If you‚Äôre looking to be part of a dynamic team that‚Äôs shaping the future of retail, we‚Äôd love to meet you.


bonial welcomes both full- and part-timers!

Environment

We are seeking a dynamic and results-oriented Product Manager with a data-driven and pragmatic mindset to join our Product Management team.

As part of our User-Facing Product team, you will work closely with our Marketing, Engineering, and Data teams to optimize our web acquisition funnels for kaufda.de, meinprospekt.de, and bonial.fr.

Your main goal will be to improve the acquisition funnel for our multi-user platform ‚Äì increasing SEO visibility in an AI-driven landscape while enhancing the user experience. In addition, you will lay the foundation for marketing technologies that empower our mobile marketing teams, acting as a sparring partner between Marketing, Product, Engineering, and Data.

By connecting stakeholder needs and user insights into a cohesive big picture, you will help drive the success of all three brands and own the Acquisition Domain alongside your peers in Marketing and Engineering.

Responsibilities

  • Accountability: Take end-to-end ownership of business outcomes within the ‚ÄúAcquisition Domain‚Äù on web for kaufda.de, meinprospekt.de and bonial.fr.

  • Collaborate: With Engineering, Designers, and stakeholders with focus on SEO to ensure the team is "building the right things right".

  • Strategic Alignment: Own the big picture and ensure continuous alignment with overarching goals and OKRs.

  • Execution: Translate strategy into clear, prioritized tactics that inform roadmaps, initiatives, epics, and user stories.

  • Opportunity Discovery: Identify and prioritize opportunities through data analysis and user/market research to ensure addressing business needs and delivering value to users. Translate those opportunities into actionable initiatives with defined use cases, user scenarios, and acceptance criteria.

  • Validation: Formulate, test, and measure hypotheses to ensure initiatives deliver the intended outcomes.

  • Cross-Team Alignment: Collaborate with other Product Managers and Engineering teams to ensure maximum alignment across all teams.

  • Enablement: Support our Inbound Marketing team by onboarding them to internal tools and optimizing workflows through automation and process improvements.

  • Integration: Provide product support for the Mobile Marketing team in areas such as tracking, attribution, and automation, fostering alignment with teams like Data and Mobile Platform / App Onboarding.

  • Measurement: Define and monitor KPIs across the acquisition funnel, ensuring a consistent view of progress, impact, and opportunities for improvement.

  • Stakeholder Communication: Keep direct stakeholders and leadership informed and engaged through clear communication, structured updates, and transparent prioritization decisions.



  • User Acquisition Expertise: Proven experience in driving user acquisition, particularly on large-scale platforms that rely on SEO for traffic generation.

  • Marketing Technology Knowledge: An understanding of the functionality of common Marketing Technologies (e.g. Google Search Console, Screaming Frog, Adjust, Sistrix, or similar) is a must. Hands-on experience is a plus.

  • Agile Mindset: Comfortable working in an iterative, experiment-driven environment; able to adapt plans quickly based on learning and outcomes. Support and being able to drive change within the team.

  • Data-Informed Decision-Making: Ability to base decisions on data, define measurable goals, and track outcomes across the acquisition funnel.

  • Problem-solving: Skilled at uncovering opportunities or pain points through data and research, breaking down complex challenges, and validating hypotheses early.

  • Prioritization Skills: Strong ability to evaluate opportunities based on impact, effort, and strategic alignment.

  • Strategic Thinking: Able to connect insights across domains, define clear paths toward long-term goals, and ensure alignment with company and product strategy.

  • Business Acumen: Capable of evaluating ROI, building sound business cases, and linking initiatives to measurable business outcomes.

  • Communication Excellence: Extraordinary ability to tailor messages for diverse audiences ‚Äì including technical teams, stakeholders, and leadership ‚Äì ensuring clarity and alignment.

  • AI Literacy: Practical understanding of AI‚Äôs potential and limitations, able to identify meaningful use cases, and collaborate effectively with Engineering and Data teams on AI initiatives.

  • CMS & Internal Tools Experience: Proven experience integrating and managing headless CMS systems in complex environments (buy & build principle). Experience working with internal tools is a plus.

  • Language Proficiency: Fluent in English; German and French are a plus.

  • Work Mode: Primarily an on-site role, requiring at least 80% presence per week. On-site availability on Mondays and Thursdays for team meetings is particularly beneficial.

What We Offer:

High growth story - Bonial is a high-growth and dynamic company with continuous potential into the future. We are a leading player and a driving force in an industry that is undergoing a massive and a once-in-a-lifetime shift from print to digital.

Innovation & tech - we are a high-tech company focused on innovative technology, leveraging AI and other tools to maximize productivity and efficiency. We leverage these tools to continually enhance the performance of our company and our people, while driving results for our customers and users.

Exciting environment for professional development - strong support for your professional development, backed-up by a feedback culture to help you identify your strengths and opportunities.

Diversity - proud to be an equal opportunity workplace where we aim to enable everyone to show up as their full selves. We are committed to equal employment opportunity and to being a safe space regardless of race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, disability, gender, gender identity or gender expression.

Wellbeing - we believe mental health is as important as being fit. That's why we're giving you free access to nilo.health, a mental health app. In terms of physical training, other than our awesome gym in the office, we also cover part of the subscription to the Urban Sports Club. We can also offer you a corporate pension scheme so you don't have to worry about your retirement.

Sustainability - together with our Green team, we offer you the opportunity to engage in projects that promote sustainability, environmental development and the impact that we make on our planet.

Flexibility - at the moment, we offer flexible hours, a hybrid setup, and the option of working from abroad. We offer 28 days of holiday, additionally, you get an extra day for each calendar year (up to 30 days) and other occasions (moving, working on a social project, etc).

Modern office - Zen Rooms where employees can pray, relax or simply have some quiet time; fully equipped gym in the office, and a roof terrace for amazing social events.

Free lunch ‚Äì whenever you‚Äôre at the office, we offer you different lunch options ‚Äì and it‚Äôs all on us! Enjoy your lunch at a nearby restaurant that partners with us! Hot and cold drinks, fruit, regular varied and healthy breakfasts and other snacks at the office are, of course, always available for free for our employees.

Social Culture ‚Äì which encourages people to start conversations, build relationships and participate together in the community through regular team events.

Visa Sponsorship ‚Äì we provide visa sponsorship for those of you who are eager to join us from outside of Germany.

Partner for retail - we empower retailers to reach their customers in the most efficient and effective way possible. We see ourselves as a critical business partner for retail, and as highlighted in our Company Vision, we ‚ÄúEnrich local shopping for everyone. Everyday.‚Äù

As part of the Axel Springer Group, we also align with the Axel Springer Essentials.


If you think you could fit the bill, we'd love to hear from you!

You can check out our bonial_people Instagram or read more about bonial culture and tech on Medium.

title: Product Engineer
description:
Zentso is a leading technology consultancy for Not-For-Profits globally. We work with associations, charities, and educational bodies, transforming them into high performing organisations through the cost-effective use of progressive technology. We support organisations in fully utilising what they have or in selecting, developing and implementing new systems. We are experts in integration and developing bespoke add-on solutions. As an independent consultancy, we choose to partner with leading technology providers and give valuable guidance to help our clients.

Tasks

As a Product Engineer you will be working on the Zentso middleware ‚ÄòCloudToolz‚Äô, developing new functionality and/or implementing client requirements. You will be responsible for implementing solutions as part of larger projects and smaller tasks. You may be required to discuss with clients their business needs and translate these into best practice and best value solutions.

Main duties

  • Developing and delivering elements of work individually and as part of a wider team on various projects
  • Meeting with and discussing technical requirements with clients and providing solution recommendations focusing on value and benefits to the client
  • Training clients on their solution as built by you
  • Working on any other technical projects, internal or external, as required.

Other responsibilities

  • Commitment to maintain and contribute to the inclusive, friendly culture at Zentso
  • May need to occasionally work outside of normal hours to ensure projects are completed on time
  • Undertake training to ensure your knowledge is kept up to date
  • You will log all time in Zentso‚Äôs project management system

Requirements

  • Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Maths or Physics
  • Experience with .NET and C# - writing C# web apps and web APIs (2 years‚Äô experience preferred)
  • Experience with frontend technologies such as Javascript, CSS, HTML
  • Good understanding of database design and performance and ability to write SQL
  • Bonus: Experience working with Azure infrastructure and building CI/CD pipelines
  • Experience of working in the non-profit sector or a passion to do so
  • Strong problem-solving skills
  • Excellent communication skills (verbal and written)
  • Ability to accurately scope, plan and estimate the level of effort for tasks and take ownership of tasks
  • Ability to work well with others
  • Well organised, attention to detail and can self-manage your time effectively

Benefits

  • Place of work: The role requires at least 3 days working from our Berlin office in Friedrichshain, close to Samariterstrasse and Frankfurter Allee.
  • Salary: Dependent on experience
  • Hours of work: 37.5 per week, flexible working hours
  • Holiday entitlement: 25 days per year
  • Local gym benefit

Please add a cover letter explaining why you are a good fit for the job. We look forward to hearing from you.

title: Senior Software Engineer, Android - KMP
description:
About the team

SumUp's Point-of-Sale (POS) solution empowers cafes, shops, bars, hair salons, and other businesses to operate efficiently and grow. It offers a wide range of features, including product catalogs, inventory management, business analytics, compliance support, and loyalty tools.

Our POS solution integrates seamlessly into the SumUp SuperApp, which supports both our proprietary register hardware and mobile devices like tablets and phones.

As a Senior Android Developer, you'll collaborate with a dynamic, cross-functional team of Product Managers, Product Designers, Engineering Managers, and fellow engineers.

About the role

We're evolving toward a Kotlin Multiplatform (KMP) strategy, enabling shared development across Android and iOS. In this role, you'll learn, refine, and help implement this technology, shaping the future of our mobile apps.

You're a developer who values user-centric design, precision, and seamless collaboration. You bring structure to communication and thrive in a cross-functional environment. 

This role is on-site in Berlin, where face-to-face interactions spark innovation and teamwork.

What you'll do

  • Build new features for the item catalog within the SumUp SuperApp
  • Help improve the architecture of the application and contribute to our Kotlin Multiplatform strategy
  • Enhance and maintain our unified android app, distributed across 60+ countries, ensuring high-quality, scalable solutions
  • Shape the product's evolution by identifying opportunities for improvement and contributing to daily decision-making
  • Write thorough documentation and implement robust testing for features before shipping
  • Collaborate closely with Designer, Product Manager and Android engineers to deliver a unified UX experience across platforms
  • Coach and mentor other engineers

You'll thrive in this role if:

  • You have 8+ years experience in mobile engineering with Android and Kotlin.
  • You have 2+ years of experience working with Jetpack Compose.
  • You have a solid understanding of software design patterns (e.g., MVVM, MVI) and expertise in building modular, scalable app architectures.
  • You have good knowledge of reactive programming (Flow, Coroutines and Concurrency).
  • You have a strong grasp of testing best practices: knowing what to test, why, and how to write resilient tests.
  • You strive for clean code, and you are flexible to balance pragmatism and perfection.
  • You have a keen interest in multi-platform development using Kotlin Multiplatform.

Why you should join SumUp

  • Be part of a company that values diversity and celebrates unique perspectives.

  • Work with a global team of skilled professionals in an environment that fosters collaboration, learning, and growth.

  • Be part of a global tribe building a banking solution from the ground up and delivering impactful solutions to the real-life problems of millions of SumUp merchants all over the world

  • Career growth and learning opportunities: We invest in your development through regular training, mentorship programs, SumUp University leadership cohort and a yearly learning budget (2,000 EUR)

  • 28 days paid leave + 1 for birthday

  • Sabbatical program for tenured SumUppers

  • Join a global team where you belong: Check out our D&I Initiatives and Employee Resource Groups such as Pride Club, SumAfro, Neurodiversity, Grupos Mais, Women in Tech, and more

  • Health & wellness benefits: in-house fitness classes, gym in the office, subsidized Urban Sports Club and available psychotherapy sessions

  • A lot of other benefits such as Subsidized Public Transport Card, Kita placement assistance, Pension Scheme, Language Learning platform/courses etc.

  • Enrollment onto our virtual stock ownership program - you will own a stake in SumUp's future success.

Job Application Tip

We recognise that candidates feel they need to meet 100% of the job criteria in order to apply for a job. Please note that this is only a guide. If you don't tick every box, it's ok too because it means you have room to learn and develop your career at SumUp.

title: Senior iOS Engineer
description:
About the role

As a Senior iOS Engineer on the Hardware team, you'll build the experiences that connect our SuperApp to the physical devices that power everyday transactions. You'll work at the intersection of hardware, mobile, and real-time communication, ensuring our merchants enjoy a flawless payment experience, no matter the conditions.

This is a hands-on, high-impact engineering role where you'll collaborate across disciplines ‚Äî from embedded firmware to product design ‚Äî to bring delightful, resilient, and intuitive device experiences to life. You should be a mobile engineer with a product mindset who can fully own the features you are working on and remain flexible with changing priorities.

About the team

You have probably used our card readers to buy a cappuccino or pay your hairdresser already. In Hardware, we are passionate about creating these beautifully designed card payment devices and accessories that enable our merchants to start, run, and grow their own businesses. In doing so, we deal with a diverse range of engineering topics - industrial and electronic design, embedded systems, all the way to mobile apps and backend services.

You'll tackle complex technical challenges, refine our modular architecture, and build elegant, server-driven UI solutions for diverse markets.

This isn't just about writing code ‚Äì it's about crafting a product with purpose. You'll have the chance to see your impact at scale, collaborate globally, and deepen your skills in a supportive and innovative environment. Together, let's redefine what banking can do for small businesses.

What you'll do

  • Develop and maintain SDKs and features that connect our iOS app to Bluetooth-enabled payment devices.
  • Ensure secure, reliable, and low-latency communication between hardware and mobile apps.
  • Own critical flows like device pairing, firmware updates, and transaction handling.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams (Product, Embedded, Backend, QA) to deliver smooth end-to-end payment experiences.
  • Champion clean architecture, modular design, and robust testing strategies.

You'll be great for this position if,

  • You have experience building and shipping complex iOS apps or SDKs in both Objective-C & Swift.
  • You have good knowledge of architectural design patterns such as MVVM and MVC, and experience ensuring modularized and scalable app architecture
  • You're comfortable with Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) and debugging connectivity issues.
  • You understand multithreading, asynchronous flows, and low-level APIs in iOS.
  • You strive for clean code, but also know how to be pragmatic when needed
  • Your precise communication skills are well suited to working in a distributed team

Why you should join SumUp

üåç Opportunity to work with SumUppers globally on large-scale fintech products used by millions of businesses worldwide, from our Berlin office. This involves an office-first setup

üßë‚Äçüî¨ We take learning and experimentation seriously with Hack Days every second Friday, and entire global Hack Weeks.

üåà Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion: Be part of a workplace that values and promotes diversity, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone's perspectives are respected and embraced

üìö A dedicated annual L&D budget of ‚Ç¨2,000 for attending conferences and/or advancing your career through further education

üöÄ Enrolment onto our VSOP program: You will own a stake in SumUp's future success

üí∂ A corporate pension scheme where we match up to 20% of your contributions

üîÑ 30 Days Sabbatical: Enjoy the unique opportunity to take a well-deserved break with our 30 days sabbatical benefit after completing 3 years of employment with SumUp

üîó Referral Bonus: Earn additional rewards by referring talented individuals to join the SumUp team

üöµüèæ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Numerous other benefits such as Urban Sports Club subsidy, Kita placement assistance, relocation assistance, subsidised office lunches

Job Application Tip

We recognise that candidates feel they need to meet 100% of the job criteria in order to apply for a job. Please note that this is only a guide. If you don't tick every box, it's ok too because it means you have room to learn and develop your career at SumUp.

title: Workforce Management Global Intraday Lead
description:
About Wolt

At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we're building the delivery of (almost) everything and you'll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.

Working at Wolt isn't always easy, but it's definitely exciting. Here you'll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You'll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you're a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.

At Wolt, we're on a mission to deliver exceptional service experiences globally. Our Global Workforce Management (WFM) team is at the heart of this mission, ensuring we can meet customer needs swiftly and efficiently, no matter where they are. We're looking for a Global Intraday Lead to join our team and drive a unified, global approach to real-time WFM across more than 30 countries.

In this high-impact role, you'll be instrumental in shaping how we monitor, manage, and react in real-time. You'll coordinate with over 120 shift leads, establishing standardized processes, tools, and playbooks to maximize service levels and ensure we can recover quickly from any unexpected incidents. Your work will be critical to our success, and you'll collaborate closely with regional WFM leads, global planning teams, and real-time coordinators. You'll also be supported by a robust analytics and product team, ensuring you have the tools and insights you need to succeed.

What you'll be doing

Day-to-day in this role you'll:

  • Build and lead a new global intraday WFM team - hiring, developing, and setting up ways of working that scale.
  • Keep an eye on real-time performance across 30+ countries to make sure our service levels stay where they should be.
  • Create and maintain global playbooks for intraday management, including alerts, priorities, and response actions.
  • Design clear processes and tools to make operations smoother, faster, and as automated as possible.
  • Set up strong planning and incident management frameworks so we can react quickly when things don't go as planned.
  • Coach and guide shift leads and intraday coordinators, helping them grow and perform at their best.
  • Work closely with analytics, product, and planning teams to make sure dashboards and data support smart decisions.
  • Drive continuous improvement by reviewing results, spotting patterns, and fixing root causes before they grow.

Our humble expectations

  • 5+ years of experience in Workforce Management
  • A natural, experienced leader (40 - 50 direct reports), able to build and lead teams.
  • Experience starting things from scratch - setting up new processes, teams, or functions that scaled successfully.
  • Strong strategic mindset - you know how to create a roadmap and deliver on it efficiently.
  • Excellent understanding of WFM tools, metrics, and real-time operations in a global or multi-country setup.
  • Analytical, data-driven, and comfortable using dashboards and insights to guide decisions.
  • Fluent in English and confident in communicating clearly and simply.

Next steps

Sounds like the perfect fit? We can't wait to meet you. Apply now and let's shape the future of WFM together!

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

We're committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That's why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: Payment Partnerships Manager
description:
About SumUp

We believe in the everyday hero ‚Äî those who have the courage to follow their passion and the determination to realise their dreams.

Small business owners are at the heart of everything we do. That's why we're building powerful, easy-to-use financial solutions to help them run their businesses. With a founder's mentality and a team-first attitude, our diverse teams across Europe, South America, and the United States work together to ensure small business owners can be successful doing what they love.

 

Team Description

You'll join the team behind SumUp's global relationships with banks, acquirers, and card schemes. This small, high-impact team drives our ability to launch new markets, optimise transaction costs, and maintain compliance and reliability in every payment we process.

As a Payment Partnerships Manager, you'll support ongoing partner relationships, coordinate operational and compliance requests, and help strengthen SumUp's global payment network. You'll collaborate closely with our PayOps, Compliance, Legal, and Finance teams ‚Äî working at the intersection of strategy, operations, and partner management.

üìç Learn more about our Berlin office

 

What You'll Do

  • Manage day-to-day requests from external partners such as banks, acquirers, and card schemes

  • Coordinate information requests, onboarding documentation, and annual due diligence questionnaires
  • Leverage your understanding of SQL and data analytics tools to build queries, analyse performance metrics, and present actionable insights

  • Support compliance and KYC refresh processes in collaboration with internal teams

  • Maintain regular partner communications and assist in meetings, reporting, and follow-ups

  • Work cross-functionally with PayOps, Finance, and Compliance to ensure accuracy and timely delivery of partnership requirements

You'll Be Great for This Role If

  • You have 2-4 years of experience in payments, fintech, or banking, and are eager to grow into a broader partnerships role.

  • You bring solid communication and organisational skills, with the ability to handle multiple partner requests at once.

  • You're familiar with payment ecosystems: schemes, acquirers, issuers, or PSPs.

  • You have an analytical mindset and commercial and financial acumen (e.g. understanding incentives, transaction economics, fee structures).

  • You're proactive, adaptable, and thrive in dynamic, fast-paced environments.

 

Why You Should Join SumUp

üåé Opportunity to work with SumUppers globally on large-scale fintech products used by millions of businesses worldwide, from our Berlin office. This involves an office-first setup.
üåà Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion: be part of a workplace that values and promotes diversity, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone's perspectives are respected and embraced
üìö A dedicated annual L&D budget of ‚Ç¨2000 for attending conferences and/or advancing your career through further education

üöÄ Enrolment onto our Virtual Stock Option Programme: you will own a stake in SumUp's future success 
üí∂ A corporate pension scheme where we match up to 20% of your contributions
üèñ Generous time off: enjoy 28 days of paid leave plus public holidays and special leave days
üí™ Numerous other benefits such as Urban Sports Club subsidy, Kita placement assistance, subsidised office lunches
üå¥ Break4me: 1-month sabbatical after 3 years of service
üîó Referral Bonus: earn additional rewards by referring talented individuals to join the SumUp team

 

At SumUp, we're on a mission to empower small businesses around the world with simple, affordable tools to help them start, run, and grow. More than 4 million merchants across 36 markets trust us as their financial partner ‚Äî and we're just getting started.

We're a global team of 3,000+ people from over 90 nationalities, united by curiosity, collaboration, and care. Our core values and culture shape everything we do, fostering inclusion, learning, and belonging.

SumUp is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer, committed to building a safe, respectful, and diverse workplace where everyone can thrive.

üëâ Explore more about our culture on our careers site, or follow us on LinkedIn and Instagram.

 

Job Application Tip

We recognise that candidates feel they need to meet 100% of the job criteria in order to apply for a job. Please note that this is only a guide. If you don't tick every box, it's ok too because it means you have room to learn and develop your career at SumUp.

title: Finance Assistant (f/m/d)
description:
Clariness is looking for a Finance Assistant (f/m/d) based in Hamburg.
- Full-time/Part-time (80-100%); unlimited -

About the role: 

We're looking for a Finance Assistant who has a love for numbers, a sharp eye for detail, and a genuine desire to keep things running smoothly behind the scenes.
In this role, you'll play an important part in our accounting team, ensuring that invoices are processed accurately, reports are prepared on time, and financial documentation is always reliable. If you enjoy structured work and value stability and teamwork, this could be the perfect next step for you.

 

As a Finance Assistant (f/m/d), you would be responsible for:

  • Processing incoming and outgoing invoices, from entry to posting and follow-up.
  • Preparing cost center reports and support month-end and year-end closings.
  • Helping manage expense approvals and workflows using Candis.
  • Supporting reconciliations and ensure accurate, up-to-date financial records.
  • Communicating with colleagues and vendors to clarify invoice or payment details.
  • Taking on general finance and administrative tasks to support the wider team.

 

We would like you to have: 

  • Completed commercial or accounting-related training (e.g., Kaufm√§nnische Ausbildung or equivalent).
  • First experience in finance administration, invoicing, or a similar support role.
  • Good knowledge of MS Office; experience with Candis is a plus.
  • Fluent in German and comfortable communicating in English.
  • A structured, precise, and reliable way of working.
  • You enjoy organization, teamwork, and being the person others can count on.

 

You may ask now, why should I work for you? Let us give you a few reasons ‚Äì more you will find out during the process.

  • A varied and exciting job with a lot of personal responsibility in an international company, where you can develop and expand your skills.
  • Professional and personal development opportunities - incl. personal development budget.
  • Flexible working hours and mobile working.
  • Regular team events and open feedback culture.
  • A versatile field of activity and challenging projects.
  • A supportive and open company culture, providing the opportunity to collaborate with a diverse and professional team.
  • Impact healthcare by accelerating medical innovation through improved access to clinical trials, potentially bringing needed treatments to patients faster.

 

How to apply & what to expect: 

  • Apply via link (CV only; no cover letter required).
  • Introductory call (30 min) ‚Üí Technical interview ‚Üí  Take Home Test ‚Üí Demo Day ‚Üí Decision.
  • We aim to move promptly and keep you updated at every step. 

 

At Clariness, we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees, regardless of race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, disability or age.

For more information, feel free to reach out to

Have we sparked your interest?

Would you like to become part of our dynamic, curious, and international culture with plenty of room for your ideas and creativity in an inspiring atmosphere? If so, we look forward to receiving your application with details of your desired salary and possible starting date, preferably via our application portal.

Clariness GmbH will treat the above information strictly confidential and will especially observe the applicable provisions of the applicable data protection laws. Further information about the use of the applicant data, you will find in the data protection declaration online at https://www.clariness.com/privacy-policy/

description:
About Wolt

At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we're building the delivery of (almost) everything and you'll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.

Working at Wolt isn't always easy, but it's definitely exciting. Here you'll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You'll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you're a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.

We're looking for a highly skilled iOS Engineer to join our Design System team. This team is at the core of our user experience, developing the critical, shared UI components that empower product teams across Wolt. You'll work in close collaboration with both design and engineering to build the foundation of our product. 

This is a distributed cross-functional team consisting of web and mobile engineers, and an engineering team lead. We value autonomy and ownership, and each team member plays a key role in shaping the product and driving it forward.

What you'll be doing

This is a hands-on technical role focused on developing and maintaining our core mobile UI components on the iOS platform. You will work closely with design and product to ensure our design system is robust, performant, and accessible across all Wolt apps.

Day-to-day in this role you'll:

  • Develop, test, and maintain high-quality, reusable UI components for iOS
  • Collaborate closely with product designers to translate design specifications into pixel-perfect and accessible components
  • Drive the adoption and proper usage of the iOS components by consulting and partnering with product teams across Wolt
  • Ensure all components adhere to the highest standards of performance, accessibility, and clear documentation
  • Contribute to key architectural decisions related to the mobile parts of the design system

Our humble expectations

  • 3+ years of software development experience, with a strong background in modern mobile engineering
  • Expertise in Swift and the iOS SDK, with experience ideally in both UIKit and SwiftUI
  • Appetite to learn about Android development
  • A strong commitment to developing highly accessible, performant, and well-tested mobile user interfaces

Next steps

For this position, you can be based either in Berlin or Helsinki.

The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

We're committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That's why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: Finance & Strategy Manager, Courier Group
description:
About Wolt

At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we're building the delivery of (almost) everything and you'll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.

Working at Wolt isn't always easy, but it's definitely exciting. Here you'll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You'll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you're a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.

We are seeking an experienced Manager to join our Finance & Strategy (F&S) team and support the Global Courier function.

The Logistics (Courier) function is responsible for our operations globally as well as trust & safety. The function ensures we have the right courier supply balance, growing efficiency across our courier operations, and helps courier partners deliver more with fair compensation. The function also drives the development and execution of comprehensive strategies, policies and initiatives as we're pushing to have the best real-time customer support in the world.

The Courier Finance & Strategy team plays a key role in the success of Wolt, strategically and financially. The team owns the P&L and ensures the right capital allocation within given constraints to hit the operational targets. You will support the function leadership in establishing a vision forward, setting ambitious targets and supporting the organization in reaching them. Your work will cover performance tracking, capital allocation proposals, developing advanced financial models, analyzing data and providing valuable business insights for decision making. As part of the Team, you will be a financial and strategic partner for the Courier functions leadership globally.

The team is part of the global Finance & Strategy team, closely partnering up with our Global Head of Operations. In your work, you will also collaborate closely with accounting, analytics, product and local market teams. Our finance and analytics teams provide the treasure trove of high quality data for you to base your work on, and you will jointly develop our reporting and data structures with them to enable us to do even more. There are exciting opportunities in product development, and you will participate in that work, helping us prioritize our efforts as we unlock even more possibilities for us and our partners to succeed through technology. Ultimately, our regions and local markets are executing the plans and you will work closely with them to make our visions become reality.

What you'll be doing

  • Support and drive the process of providing financial and strategic targets in close collaboration with the Courier leadership
  • Identify and analyze trends, variances, and key performance indicators to provide insights and recommendations on strategic capital allocation to management
  • Develop advanced financial models to support business planning and decision-making
  • Help prepare and analyze financial reports, including weekly, monthly and quarterly management reports, forecasts and budgets for Courier function
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including sales, marketing, and operations to understand business drivers and influence decision making
  • Participate in developing and maintaining financial reporting and analysis tools to enhance the accuracy and efficiency of financial analysis
  • Ad-hoc financial analysis and reporting requests as needed
  • Participate in the continued development of accurate and effective financial reporting for Courier, ensuring accuracy and completeness of financial data and compliance with accounting standards and policies

Our humble expectations

  • Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, or a related field
  • Relevant experience in a highly analytical role like Investment Banking, Consulting, FP&A in Tech company or similar
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
  • Very strong analytical skills and proficiency in financial modeling and analysis tools (e.g. Google Sheets, Excel, Looker). Experience and ability to work with large amounts of data.
  • Knowledge of accounting principles and financial reporting standards
  • Good communication skills, with the ability to present complex financial information in a clear and concise manner

Next steps

If you are excited about working in a high-growth environment, taking ownership of things you care about, and being part of an ambitious group of professionals, then click below to apply and get the conversation going!

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

We're committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That's why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: Backend Developer - Full-Time (all genders)
description:
About us

At kiresult, we‚Äôre reshaping the procurement analytics landscape with our advanced SaaS solution, helping companies to unlock the power of data for smarter decision-making. Our platform transforms procurement data into valuable insights, providing companies with strategic advantages and cost-saving opportunities.

Tasks

Who We're Looking For

You're a backend engineer passionate about building robust, scalable systems that power data-driven applications. Python micro-services, Docker containers, MongoDB, and CI/CD pipelines are your daily toolkit. Here, your contributions matter and can influence enterprise customers directly ‚Äîand if you want to grow into a full-stack role, you‚Äôll have the chance to do so.

Role Overview

As a Backend Developer at kiresult, you'll be central to our development team‚Äîbuilding and maintaining the services that power our procurement analytics platform. You'll own backend feature delivery end-to-end, from database schema design to REST API endpoints and background job orchestration.

Key Responsibilities

1. Feature Development

  • Build new API endpoints and background jobs using Python and FastAPI
  • Design and implement scalable data processing jobs (Celery, asyncio)
  • Develop features that power decisions on billions in procurement spend

2. Code Quality & Testing

  • Drive test-driven development with pytest and maintain healthy test coverage
  • Conduct peer code reviews and uphold internal coding standards
  • Write unit and integration tests that ensure service reliability

3. Performance & Reliability

  • Profile services, optimize MongoDB queries, and implement caching strategies
  • Introduce async patterns and fine-tune database aggregation pipelines
  • Implement robust logging, monitoring, and alerting to ensure system health, uptime, and quick incident response

4. DevOps & Containerization

  • Define, build, and run Docker images and containers for development, testing, and production
  • Contribute to CI/CD pipelines (GitHub Actions, GitLab CI/CD)
  • Support infrastructure-as-code and container orchestration basics

5. Collaboration & Leadership

  • Engage actively in sprint planning, architecture sessions, and demos
  • Mentor junior engineers and working students; share knowledge through pair programming and internal talks.
  • Partner with frontend engineers and cross-functional teams to deliver complete features

Requirements

Must-Haves

  • At least 1+ years professional experience in backend or full-stack engineering
  • Strong proficiency in Python 3.x with production experience in at least three of:
    1. FastAPI / Flask
    2. Pydantic
    3. Celery or other async task queue
    4. asyncio
    5. pytest
  • Practical experience with MongoDB schema design, indexing, and aggregation pipelines
  • Solid understanding of Docker (Dockerfile authoring, image management, container orchestration basics)
  • Strong problem-solving skills and appetite for troubleshooting complex issues
  • Proven track record writing unit and integration tests and operating services in production
  • Excellent English communication skills (German a plus)

Nice-to-Haves

  • Experience with Kubernetes or similar orchestration platforms
  • Comfortable with Git-based workflows and familiarity with CI/CD tools (GitHub Actions, GitLab CI/CD)
  • Exposure to cloud services (AWS, GCP, Azure, OTC)
  • Basic frontend knowledge (React, Vue.js, TypeScript) to better collaborate across teams
  • Ambition to become a Full-Stack developer
  • Experience mentoring junior engineers or working students

Benefits

Why Join Us?

  • Real Impact ‚Äì Your code powers decisions on billions in procurement spend.
  • Ownership & Growth ‚Äì Small, senior team where every engineer shape architecture and product direction.
  • Learning Culture ‚Äì Personal development budget, conference tickets, and mentorship‚Äëpairing.
  • Flexible Work ‚Äì Remote‚Äëfirst processes and core hours.

Ready to push the boundaries of procurement analytics?

Apply with your CV, GitHub/portfolio links, and a short note on a project you‚Äôre proud of. We review every application personally and aim to reply within a week.

Join kiresult and build the technology that redefines how enterprises see their data!

title: Content Creator

Here, your work doesn‚Äôt just tell a story, it inspires a movement.

title: Global Account Management, Strategy and Operations Manager
description:
About Wolt

At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we're building the delivery of (almost) everything and you'll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.

Working at Wolt isn't always easy, but it's definitely exciting. Here you'll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You'll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you're a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.

The global merchant team ensures best-in-class restaurant and store selection for consumers while building products and services that help merchants grow their businesses profitably. We collaborate closely with commercial teams in 29 countries across our five global subteams:

  • Merchant S&O (Strategy & Operations) ‚Äì Drives merchant strategy, experience, performance tracking, and commercial go-to-market approaches.
  • Sales S&O ‚Äì Develops sales processes, tools, and enablement programs to improve productivity.
  • Merchant Operations ‚Äì Focuses on onboarding, in-store flows, self-service tooling, and integrations.
  • Enterprise ‚Äì Works with global merchant partners to grow our joint business.
  • B2B ‚Äì Develops new merchant service offerings, such as logistics as a service (Drive).

We are seeking a data-driven manager to optimize global account management processes and enable local teams to grow merchant businesses and reduce churn. This role involves analyzing, designing, and implementing scalable strategies and programs that drive operational excellence and business growth.

What you'll be doing

  • Develop and implement global programs and processes, creating strategies that drive merchant sales growth, improve profitability, and reduce churn across +30 markets.
  • Identify and scale best practices from different markets across the company.
  • Lead and manage cross-functional projects with product, analytics, marketing, legal, and finance teams.
  • Use data insights to make informed business decisions, enhance reporting, and address data gaps.
  • Train and support local account management teams by developing a centralized resource hub.
  • This role will report to the Head of Global Account Management, Merchant S&O.

Our humble expectations

  • 3+ years in management consulting, with a focus on operational improvement and process optimization, preferably in tech, platform businesses, or global retail/FMCG.
  • 1-2 years of experience in account management or sales within a tech/platform ecosystem or global retailer. Startup/scale-up experience is a plus.
  • Strong strategic thinking and analytical execution skills, with proficiency in MS Office (Excel & PowerPoint). Experience with Looker or SQL is a bonus.
  • Experience with CRM tools (Salesforce) or project management platforms (Monday.com) is an advantage.
  • Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to engage and influence teams across all levels an absolute must.
  • Strong ownership mindset, able to work independently while managing multiple projects.

Next steps

If you are excited about working with the nicest of people, in a high-growth environment, taking ownership, and being part of an ambitious team, then click below to apply and let's get the conversation going!

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

We're committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That's why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

We are an interdisciplinary group of colleagues from all over the world operating out of Berlin, one of Europe‚Äôs most-established and prominent deep-tech hubs. We are looking for the newest member of our ambitious, high-energy team to build on the strong momentum we have created.

This is a mission-critical role for a creative engineer who wants to build a game-changing technology, unleashing the potential to transform one of the most impactful and carbon-heavy industries in the world. You will be the central owner of our production, taking our first process from pilot-scale to kilotonne capacity. We need someone who can dive into computational models, and get their hands dirty building out concepts at our in-house production facilities. Your work will then be realised at an industrial scale as Level Nine begins decarbonising the chemicals industry en masse with our nanozyme technology. In short, you‚Äôll be the turbo charge of our scale-up; it‚Äôs a significant undertaking, but an awesome opportunity to take full ownership of a project with an incredible potential for change.

Though we have a number of hard criteria below, our hiring ethos is focussed on attitude over aptitude. We‚Äôre not just interested in what you‚Äôve done, but also why you think it was worth doing. This is far from a desk-only job, and we seek an out-of-the-box thinker who brings an entrepreneurial spirit and a can-do attitude. If you share in our excitement of building a novel, FOAK (first-of-a-kind) process from the ground up, then this opportunity is a clear launchpad to further their career with Level Nine.

Tasks

  • Be the architect of a breakthrough industrial transformation that unlocks our technology‚Äôs full potential, holding key responsibilities for achieving our mission of a green transformation
  • Own the end-to-end process development and scale-up of our core reaction and downstream separation technology, propelling our process from pilot to production
  • Model and simulate process optimisations in Aspen (or similar) to drive down OPEX, improve energy efficiency, and validate the techno-economics as we scale
  • Lead activities at our in-house pilot facilities, getting hands-on with equipment to test, troubleshoot, and validate our hypotheses and drive breakthroughs
  • Generate and codify a deep process understanding of our technology to guide our R&D and scale-up strategies
  • Collaborate directly with internal and external partners to translate our technical knowledge into a clear, scalable engineering design package

Requirements

  • Experience: 5+ years in chemical process development, R&D, and/or scale-up
  • Able to confidently test and validate engineering hypotheses using process simulation software and in-house experimentation, leading to the development of robust computational models that can guide our FEED.
  • Left-brain/right-brain engineering magic, able to be the architect of process concepts and simultaneously the hands-on builder-tester-troubleshooter
  • Feels comfortable working in ambiguity, using pragmaticism and a collaborative approach to overcome challenges together and thrive in our highly-ambitious startup environment
  • Commercially savvy, with an ability to contextualise and translate engineering results into actionable feedback to the business that helps us and our clients achieve our goals.
  • Demonstrable experience in catalysis, reaction engineering, separation processes (or indeed successfully scaling these processes) is a strong foundation for this role
  • Big picture frame of mind, understanding how quality, operational excellence and regulatory systems work at industrially relevant scales and embedding this into your design
  • Fluent communication in English essential; B1+ proficiency in German desirable

At Level Nine, we're looking for people with ambition, resilience and integrity. You're encouraged to apply even if your experience doesn't precisely match the job description. Your skills and passion are what will stand out and set you apart. We strongly welcome diverse perspectives and people who have the courage and conviction to make real change.

How to apply

To apply, please submit your CV alongside a cover letter containing some details about yourself and why you're interested in working at Level Nine. Please don't send us a standard cover letter - instead, please send a brief, one-two paragraph answer to the following questions:

  • What's the biggest risk you've ever taken, and what did you learn from it?
  • What are you passionate about outside of work that makes you uniquely you?
  • If you could learn any new skill, what would it be and why?

title: Solution Engineer (f/m/d)
description:
Join us and help shape the future of pharmaceutical data

At ACCURIDS, we‚Äôre building the data backbone behind life-science innovation ‚Äî a system that identifies, links and standardises critical enterprise data in compliance with global regulations such as ISO IDMP. We help global life-science companies launch products faster, more safely and with better patient outcomes.

At ACCURIDS, you‚Äôll join a collaborative, growth-driven environment where your work makes a real impact from day one.

Tasks

How you'll make an impact:

  • Architect customer-facing solutions and define technical concepts
  • Develop and deploy hands-on Proofs of Concept (PoCs) to demonstrate our platform's value to our clients
  • Engineer custom platform extensions in Java (Spring Boot) to map individual workflows
  • Implement integration scripts and "middleware" in Python to connect ACCURIDS with external customer tools (e.g., via REST APIs).
  • Lead technical workshops with customer SMEs to translate vague requirements into clear, technical solutions
  • Provide expert-level technical support: analyze complex issues (e.g., via log analysis) and find fast, pragmatic solutions
  • Create clear technical documentation, diagrams, and guides for the solutions you build

Requirements

What helps you succeed:

  • 3-5 years of hands-on, practical experience in a professional software development environment
  • A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent practical experience
  • Proven experience in Python scripting (ideally for data integration / APIs) and backend development with Java (Spring Boot)
  • Solid knowledge of relational databases (especially PostgreSQL)
  • Strong analytical skills with a proven ability to translate vague business requirements into a concrete technical architecture
  • Excellent communication skills to proactively convey technical details to internal teams and external customer stakeholders
  • A proven ability to write high-quality technical documentation
  • Experience in the Life Science industry or a clear motivation to dive into this domain. Experience in other data-heavy, regulated industries (e.g., Healthcare, FinTech) is also a plus.
  • Knowledge of cloud platforms (e.g., AWS), Elasticsearch, or Knowledge Graphs (SPARQL) is also a plus, but not a requirement.

Benefits

Why you'll love working here:

  • Flexible work model: Choose the setup that suits you best ‚Äì on-site or enjoy the flexibility to work from home
  • 30 days of paid vacation for a healthy work-life balance.
  • Competitive salary package aligned with your experience and impact.
  • Personal growth and development: Access a flexible budget for training, conferences, or other learning opportunities that support your individual development goals.
  • Choose your perk: Enjoy either a subsidized Urban Sports Club membership or a City Plus Card with a ‚Ç¨50 monthly allowance.
  • Empowerment and ownership: Take responsibility and shape your role as we grow together.
  • Modern work setup: Select your preferred system and hardware ‚Äì Windows, Linux, or Mac.
  • Collaborative culture: Be part of a dynamic, start-up-like environment that values flexibility, trust, and innovation.

Not ticking every box? We encourage you to apply anyway! We know great talent doesn‚Äôt always follow a checklist and we care more about your potential, curiosity, and motivation to learn.

At ACCURIDS, we‚Äôre committed to building a diverse and inclusive team. We especially encourage women and people from underrepresented backgrounds in tech, science, and data to apply.

title: CRO Product Owner (m/f/d)
description:
About the Job

Are you passionate about turning insights into action and driving meaningful user experiences? We‚Äôre looking for a hands-on CRO Product Owner to lead the charge on optimizing our websites through data-driven experimentation.

In this role, you'll take ownership of the full A/B testing lifecycle‚Äîbringing fresh ideas to the table, executing impactful tests, analyzing results, and documenting learnings that fuel continuous improvement. You'll work side by side with designers, content writers and developers to uncover what works, what doesn‚Äôt, and why.

You‚Äôll also contribute to competitor and funnel analysis, helping us better understand where users drop off and how we compare in the market. This is a great opportunity for someone who thrives on collaboration, loves digging into data, and enjoys seeing their work directly impact user journeys and business outcomes.

This is what you'll do

  • Own the full A/B testing lifecycle: ideation, setup, execution, analysis, and documentation
  • Collaborate closely with design, content, and IT teams to implement test ideas efficiently
  • Write clear user stories and technical tasks for developers, with defined success criteria
  • Own and maintain the analytics setup across multiple websites
  • Perform funnel and competitor analysis to inform testing opportunities
  • Use web analytics tools to generate actionable insights and prioritize test ideas
  • Draw actionable insights from test results and create a library of documented learnings
  • Prioritize and run tests that contribute to conversion improvements and business growth

This is what you‚Äôve got

  • Experience in Conversion Optimizaiton, digital experimentation, or performance marketing
  • Hands-on experience with A/B testing tools (e.g., Google Optimize, Optimizely) and tag management systems (e.g., Google Tag Manager, Matomo)
  • Strong understanding of web analytics and user behavior metrics
  • Analytical mindset with the ability to turn data into clear, testable ideas
  • Comfortable writing technical specs or user stories for development teams
  • Detail-oriented, conscientious, and confident in making decisions
  • Excellent collaboration and communication skills
  • Fluent in English; German is a plus

About Us

We Love X is a leading force in the affiliate space, dedicated to making advertising always add value. Starting as a SEA-focused company, we've expanded into broader PPC channels, TV advertising, and SEO.

As the world's largest affiliate in the dating market, we operate 200 websites across 12 languages, specializing in driving high-quality traffic and simplifying purchasing decisions with effective marketing funnels.Driven and founderled, our bootstrapped and independent status allows us to innovate and quickly adapt to market needs. Join us in creating the super affiliate of tomorrow's dating industry.

title: SEA Manager (m/f/d) - German Speaking
description:
About the Job

We‚Äôre looking for a proactive and analytical SEA Manager to take full ownership of medium to large accounts. This role is at the core of our paid marketing engine‚Äîfocused on hands-on campaign execution, day-to-day optimizations, and data-driven improvements.

You‚Äôll be responsible for boosting account performance, maintaining high campaign hygiene, and collaborating with other teams to ensure alignment across funnels and markets.

This is a great opportunity for someone who thrives on performance marketing, loves digging into data, and enjoys sharing insights that move the needle. Whether it‚Äôs testing copy, analyzing funnel friction, or identifying competitive opportunities‚Äîyou‚Äôll play a key role in scaling our paid search efforts.

This is what you'll do

  • Own and optimize medium to large SEA accounts, ensuring profitability, strong margin levels, and healthy account growth
  • Maximize profitability and proactively communicate account performance based on traffic mix, bucket, and keyword quality
  • Plan, execute, and continuously improve SEA campaigns across Google and Microsoft Ads
  • Maintain account hygiene and apply SEA best practices consistently
  • Translate data into actionable insights and contribute to strategic SEA development
  • Share learnings across the team and help build a knowledge-driven culture
  • Identify growth opportunities and flag risks to inform broader business decisions

This is what you‚Äôve got

  • Hands on experience managing and scaling SEA campaigns with a performance-driven mindset
  • Data-driven outlook with strong analytical skills to turn campaign data into actionable insights
  • Strong knowledge of Google Ads and Microsoft Ads platforms, including practical skills with Google Ads Editor and Excel/Google Sheets
  • Excellent communication skills in English and German (C1+)
  • Comfortable working independently while collaborating closely with other teams
  • Open to feedback, self-aware, and eager to grow
  • Creative problem solver with an eye for detail and a hands-on mentality

About Us

We Love X is a leading force in the affiliate space, dedicated to making advertising always add value. Starting as a SEA-focused company, we've expanded into broader PPC channels, TV advertising, and SEO.

As the world's largest affiliate in the dating market, we operate 200 websites across 12 languages, specializing in driving high-quality traffic and simplifying purchasing decisions with effective marketing funnels.Driven and founderled, our bootstrapped and independent status allows us to innovate and quickly adapt to market needs. title: Freelance SEO Manager (all genders)
description:
We are seeking a Freelance SEO Manager to join our team through the end of March. In this role, you will be responsible for supporting our multilingual content strategy and optimization efforts.   • Make precise, high-quality edits to copy; commission or produce new content as needed.
  • Support similar SEO efforts for our French domain (smaller volume).

Technical SEO:

  • Ensure all pages align with SEO best practices for site health and visibility.

SEO Tools & Performance Tracking:

  • Track, report, and act on key SEO metrics; support the Head of SEO with ongoing performance analysis.

You have

  • Native-level German fluency (required); French proficiency is a plus.

  • Comfortable working with content management systems and collaborating with remote teams.
  • Familiarity with major SEO tools (Google Search Console, Google Analytics, Brightedge, SEMrush, etc.).
  • Organized, proactive, and able to work independently.

Why Babbel?

  • Excellent working conditions in the heart of Berlin
  • Opportunity for personal growth and development: we are a learning company and take learning seriously
  • A lively startup atmosphere with friendly working hours
  • A vibrant international team from over 50 different nationalities
  • Responsibility from day one and professional and personal growth

Join one of the fastest-growing education technology companies and contribute in making learning a whole new experience!

Please note that our company‚Äôs operating language is English so you will need to be able to work in English.

Diversity at Babbel

As part of our ongoing journey towards building a diverse, equitable and inclusive company, we welcome everyone to apply, especially those individuals who are underrepresented in tech. We are a learning company, inside and out, and we encourage you to apply even if you do not fit all the technical requirements - all candidates are assessed based on skills, qualifications and on our business needs.
