title: Experienced Full Stack Backend Engineer at fast growing Berlin AI company
description:
Our Vision

At Nomitri, our ambition is bold: to become a leading worldwide player in Edge AI and Computer Vision. Smoothly running backends and cloud-to-edge deployment pipelines as well as dashboards and monitoring tools empowering customers, operators, and engineers to see and trust that our AI solutions are running reliably and at scale will be crucial to achieve this vision.

By joining us, you‚Äôll play a key role in achieving worldwide success by shaping how our already world-class AI systems are delivered and experienced at scale.¬†

The Role

We are looking for an experienced Full Stack Engineer with strong backend skills and practical broader experience crossing into cloud deployments and frontend development to join our engineering team in Berlin. You will help us design, build, and deploy our backend systems and key applications that make our AI solutions transparent, scalable, and user-friendly ‚Äî from log collection services to customer-facing KPI dashboards and automated monitoring and diagnostics tools up to secondary cloud AI modules.

This is a role for someone who enjoys working across the stack and shaping and owning complete solutions: developing web applications end-to-end, ensuring smooth deployment across devices and cloud environments, and translating customer requirements into user-friendly features and frontends.

Location: Berlin, Germany (hybrid: 3 days in-office, 2 days remote)

Why This Role Matters

As we expand our AI solutions, the smooth and scalable deployment and maintainability through continuous diagnostics as well as visibility features like customer facing dashboards are becoming as critical as the deep-tech itself. By joining us, you will:

  • Develop core backend features that take our edge based AI features to the next level

  • Scale deployments across on-prem and cloud environments, ensuring robust delivery of our AI stack.

  • Empower customers with real-time dashboards and KPIs that turn data into actionable insights.

  • Strengthen our operations by building monitoring and diagnostics services that ensure system reliability.

  • Strengthen the backend team, complementing existing engineers to ensure peer review and backend operations don‚Äôt rely on a single person.

Your work will directly enhance both customer experience and our ability to deliver at scale.

What You‚Äôll Do

  • Implement backend services and APIs (RESTful, and optionally GraphQL) to support higher-level AI features and frontend functionality.

  • Design, develop, and maintain responsive dashboards and web applications for internal and external users.

  • Ensure smooth containerized GitOps based deployments (Docker, Kubernetes, ArgoCD) across devices and environments.

  • Integrate with and optimize CI/CD pipelines (GitLab CI/CD, Jenkins) for automated builds, testing, and deployment.

  • Deploy and maintain applications on cloud platforms (AWS, GCP) as well as on-premise environments.

Collaborate with ML, DevOps, and product teams to ensure seamless integration of dashboards and backend systems.



What You Bring (Must-Have Skills)

  • Broad expertise in full stack web application development (frontend & backend).

  • Backend: Strong experience with Java, Node.js, Python, or Ruby ‚Äî and RESTful API development.

  • Frontend: Solid proficiency in React, Angular, or Vue.js ‚Äî with proven ability to build clean, intuitive dashboards.

  • Containerization: Solid hands-on experience with Docker and orchestration (Kubernetes).

  • CI/CD: Experience setting up and maintaining CI/CD pipelines (GitLab CI/CD, Jenkins, etc.).

  • Cloud & On-Prem: Proven experience deploying web applications in both cloud and on-prem environments.

Nice to Have

  • Familiarity with GraphQL for optimized API queries.

  • UI/UX sensibility ‚Äî able to design dashboards that are both functional and visually appealing.

  • Experience handling real-time data streams (WebSockets, live KPIs).

  • Understanding of web application security (OAuth, JWT, secure API practices).

  • Knowledge of monitoring tools like Prometheus, Grafana, ELK stack.

  • Experience with data visualization techniques for technical and non-technical users.

  • Exposure to serverless architectures (AWS Lambda, Google Cloud Functions).

Who You Are (Cultural Fit)

  • Comfortable in a hybrid setup (3 days office / 2 days).

  • Thrive in a fast-learning environment and enjoy solving tough problems.

  • Take ownership of your workstreams and care about running systems staying healthy.

  • Comfortable in participating in active yet open minded discussions

  • Enjoy being able to drive product development ideas and work in fast iterative cycles

  • Willing to step in during critical issues, even outside core hours.

  • Motivated by direct impact and product ownership.

  • Enjoy working in a DevOps-rich, collaborative, senior engineering team.

What We Offer

  • The chance to build with us the backend systems, deployment pipelines, dashboards, tools, and services that make AI systems truly usable at scale.

  • A world-class engineering team (ex-Facebook, ex-Amazon, Cambridge, ex-Qualcomm, ex-ASML, and more).

  • A culture that values impact over politics: flat, international, fast-moving, and respectful.

  • Long-term stability as a wholly owned subsidiary of GK Software, Europe‚Äôs leading POS software provider.

  • A Berlin-first culture with hybrid flexibility.

Not what you‚Äôre looking for? Not a problem, stay connected with us via LinkedIn or look into our website www.nomitri.com, in case more fitting job opportunities are available in the future.¬†

title: ERP Dynamics Specialist (all genders)
description:
About us:
Dellner Group is a privately owned industrial investment company that owns and invests in businesses across different industrial sectors. Dellner Group businesses are world leading global suppliers of braking, hydraulic, polymer and glass products and solutions across the material handling, wind energy, marine, oil and gas, industrial and transportation sectors. Dellner Group has a buy and build strategy and a track record of acquiring companies with high development potential. Our primary focus is on sustainable value creation, and we achieve this through professional and entrepreneurial management teams, strong customer relationships and diligent focus on organic growth in our portfolio companies.

Tasks

To strengthen our global DELLNER BUBENZER Wind team, we are looking for an experienced ERP Dynamics 365 F&O expert with focus on finance or production to support us in the optimization and further development of our ERP system and general processes. DELLNER BUBENZER Wind is headquartered in Germany, but have operations also in China, Spain, US, Czech, Poland, Brazil and India and is expanding rapidly in the wind energy sector, both onshore and offshore.

Your tasks:

  • Support, maintenance and further development of our ERP system Microsoft Dynamics 365 F&O
  • Analysis of business processes and implementation of suitable solutions and developments
  • Support with the integration of Dynamics 365 with other systems
  • Training and support for local end users
  • Collaboration in project planning and implementation in the area of ERP

Requirements

  • Completed studies in the field of computer science, business informatics or a comparable qualification
  • Several years of experience with Microsoft Dynamics 365 ERP systems
  • Sound knowledge in the configuration, customization and integration of Dynamics 365 F&O
  • Good knowledge of SQL, Power Automate, Power BI or other relevant tools is an advantage
  • Very good English skills, futher languages are an advantageAnalytical thinking, ability to work in a team and a solution-oriented way of working

Benefits

  • A dynamic and collegial working environment
  • Flat hierarchies with short decision-making paths
  • Diverse training and development opportunities
  • Flexible working hours and home office options
  • Employer-financed company pension scheme

At Dellner Group we are committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse working place where every individual is valued and respected. We believe that our strength lies in our differences and that a diverse team drives innovation, creativitiy and success. We are possionate about what we do and go the extra mile to serve our customers, develop our business and reach our goals together as one team.

DELLNER WIND is headquartered in Germany, but have operations also in China, Spain, US, Czech, Poland, Brazil and India and is expanding rapidly in the wind energy sector, both onshore and offshore.

We value diversity and therefore welcome all applications - regardless of gender, nationality, ethnic and social background, religion/belief, disability, age, sexual orientation and identity.

About the Group:

Dellner Group is a privately owned industrial investment company that owns and invests in businesses across different industrial sectors. Dellner Group businesses are world leading global suppliers of braking, hydraulic, polymer and glass products and solutions across the material handling, wind energy, marine, oil and gas, industrial and transportation sectors. Dellner Group has a buy and build strategy and a track record of acquiring companies with high development potential. Our primary focus is on sustainable value creation, and we achieve this through professional and entrepreneurial management teams, strong customer relationships and diligent focus on organic growth in our portfolio companies.

<text>

<title>About us</title>

<text>

With over 200 million customers in 50+ countries, Bolt is one of the fastest-growing tech companies in Europe and Africa. And it's all thanks to our people.

We believe in creating an inclusive environment where everyone is welcome, regardless of race, colour, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, or disability.

Our ultimate goal is to make cities for people, not cars, and we need your help to achieve this mission!

</text>

</gh-about-us>

<gh-role-detail>

<title>About the role</title>

<text>

As a Fleet Manager, you will be responsible for maintaining the highest level of quality of the Bolt Drive car fleet, impacting the strategy of our car fleet and supervising the on street local operations team in Germany.


You will be working closely with the Country Manager and HQ teams where your work will drive business growth and revenue through achieving operational milestones and key metrics.

  • <point>Ensuring strict servicing and maintenance times to minimize the downtime of the fleet. As well as coordinate the repair of technical defects on our vehicles.</point>
  • <point>Supporting expansion to new cities.</point>

</bulletpoints>

<gh-requirements>

<title>About you:</title>

  • <point>You have excellent communication skills in English and German.<point>

title: Senior Backend Developer / DevOps
description:
Company

We are a Berlin-based B2C fintech operating in stealth, founded by two repeat founders (YC alum, exit) with prior 10+ year careers in investment banking and strategy consulting, respectively. We recently raised investment to assemble a 15 people, exceptionally strong core team.

Our culture is built on ownership and clarity. We align with you on vision, then set KPIs and required resources together‚Äîand then trust your drive and expertise.

The Opportunity

As a Senior Backend Developer / DevOps engineer, you will work alongside our CTO on building and evolving our fintech product. The core architecture is in place, providing a solid foundation to build upon as we set up infrastructure, establish operational practices, refine our systems, and ship to production. You'll be involved from infrastructure creation through feature development, with significant autonomy to shape how we build, deploy, and scale.

Tasks

What you will work on on daily basis

  • Setting up and managing cloud infrastructure for production deployment
  • Building and maintaining CI/CD pipelines and deployment processes
  • Implementing monitoring, logging, and observability systems
  • Developing backend features and APIs within our microservices architecture
  • Optimizing system performance, reliability, and scalability
  • Collaborating on technical decisions and architecture evolution
  • Ensuring code quality, security, and operational best practices

Requirements

Hard Requirements

  • Event-Driven Architecture Mastery: Deep, hands-on experience designing and implementing event-driven systems with messaging patterns (Kafka, RabbitMQ, or GCP Pub/Sub). You understand event sourcing, saga patterns, eventual consistency, and can articulate trade-offs.
  • Microservices Architecture: Proven track record building, deploying, and scaling microservice-based systems in production. You know when to split services, how to handle distributed transactions, and how to avoid common microservices pitfalls.
  • Node.js Expertise: Strong proficiency in Node.js (Express, NestJS, or similar) for building high-performance backend services. Understanding of async patterns, streams, and Node.js performance optimization is essential.
  • GCP Hands-On Experience: Real production experience with GCP‚Äînot just familiarity. You've worked with GKE/Cloud Run, Cloud Functions, Pub/Sub, Cloud Storage, Cloud SQL/Firestore, and can navigate the GCP ecosystem confidently.

Additional Technical Skills

  • Extensive experience with SQL databases (PostgreSQL preferred)
  • Strong foundation in RESTful API design
  • Proficiency with containerization (Docker) and orchestration (Kubernetes)
  • Experience with CI/CD tools (GitHub Actions, Cloud Build, Jenkins, or similar)
  • Infrastructure as Code with Terraform or similar tools
  • Deep understanding of observability: structured logging, distributed tracing, metrics, and alerting
  • Knowledge of API security, authentication/authorization (OAuth 2.0, JWT), and data protection

Mindset & Approach

  • 0‚Üí1 Production Experience: You've been through production launches before and know what it takes‚Äîsetting up infrastructure, handling edge cases, ensuring reliability, and managing the inevitable surprises.
  • Pragmatic Perfectionism: You balance technical excellence with business velocity‚Äîyou know when to refactor and when to ship quickly.
  • Ownership Mentality: You're proactive, resourceful, and accountable for your work‚Äîyou don't wait to be told what to do.
  • Team Player: You collaborate well with others, give and receive feedback gracefully, and elevate those around you
  • Systems Thinking: You understand how components interact, design for reliability and maintainability, and think beyond your immediate feature.
  • Clear Communication: You can explain technical decisions to non-technical stakeholders, document your work, and participate constructively in technical discussions.
  • Continuous Learner: You stay current with industry trends, experiment with new technologies, and are energized by technical challenges.

Benefits

Compensation & How We Work

  • Competitive salary commensurate with experience (‚Ç¨80k-‚Ç¨110k+ depending on seniority)
  • On-site in Berlin-Mitte, with flexible remote work as you see fit (typically 3-4 days in office, flexible on specific days)
  • High autonomy, low politics, fast decision-making‚Äîwe value impact over process
  • Top-tier equipment‚Äîwhatever tools you need to do your best work

We're an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. If you're excited about the role but don't meet 100% of the criteria, we'd still love to hear from you‚Äîparticularly if you bring unique perspectives or experiences that would strengthen our team.

As our first dedicated Marketing/Growth leader, you will own the end-to-end customer acquisition strategy‚Äîfrom positioning and brand to channel mix, execution, and measurement. Tasks

What you‚Äôll do

  • Define, test, and scale our customer acquisition strategy across the full funnel.
  • Own budget allocation and performance across paid, organic, partnership, referral, and offline channels.

Hiring process (indicative)

  3. Practical case ‚Äì a short, real-world growth problem
  4. Team conversations & offer

Ready to build?

Send us your CV/LinkedIn and a short note on the most impactful growth system you‚Äôve built (what you did, why it worked, and the numbers you‚Äôre proud of).

title: Senior Backend Developer / AI Engineer
description:
Company

We are a Berlin-based B2C fintech operating in stealth, founded by two repeat founders (YC alum, exit) with prior 10+ year careers in investment banking and strategy consulting, respectively. We recently raised investment to assemble a 15 people, exceptionally strong core team.

Our culture is built on ownership and clarity. We align with you on vision, then set KPIs and required resources together‚Äîand then trust your drive and expertise.

The Opportunity

As a Senior Backend Developer / AI Engineer, you will work alongside our CTO on building and evolving our AI-powered fintech product. The core architecture is in place, providing a solid foundation to build upon as we integrate advanced LLM capabilities, establish AI pipelines, implement intelligent automation, and ship production-ready AI features. You'll be instrumental in shaping how we leverage AI to transform financial services, with significant autonomy to design and implement cutting-edge solutions.

Tasks

What you will work on on daily basis

  • Designing and implementing LLM-powered features and intelligent automation workflows
  • Building robust AI pipelines with proper orchestration, error handling, and monitoring
  • Developing RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) systems for financial data processing
  • Implementing and optimizing vector search and embedding strategies
  • Creating evaluation frameworks for LLM outputs and maintaining quality standards
  • Building prompt management systems and optimizing LLM interactions for cost and performance
  • Integrating multiple AI models and managing model versioning/deployment
  • Ensuring AI safety, reliability, and compliance in financial applications

Requirements

Hard Requirements

  • LLM Framework Expertise: Deep hands-on experience with LangChain.js, LangGraph for JavaScript, or similar Node.js-based LLM frameworks. You understand agent architectures, chain composition, memory management, and can build complex multi-step AI workflows in TypeScript/JavaScript.
  • Workflow Orchestration: Production experience with Temporal .io (TypeScript SDK), Bull/BullMQ, or similar Node.js-compatible orchestration solutions. You know how to build reliable, long-running workflows with proper error handling, retries, and state management.
  • Vector Database & RAG Systems: Proven experience implementing RAG architectures using vector databases (Pinecone, Weaviate, Qdrant, or pgvector) with Node.js clients. You understand embedding models, similarity search, and hybrid retrieval strategies.
  • Node.js & TypeScript Mastery: Expert-level proficiency in Node.js and TypeScript with extensive experience integrating AI services (OpenAI, Anthropic, Cohere APIs). You're comfortable with streams, async patterns, WebSockets for real-time AI responses, and optimizing for latency.

Additional Technical Skills

  • Experience with prompt engineering and prompt management systems accessible from Node.js
  • Hands-on experience with AI model APIs and their Node.js SDKs (OpenAI, Anthropic, Hugging Face, Replicate)
  • Knowledge of AI observability tools with Node.js integration (LangSmith, Helicone, or custom solutions)
  • Proficiency with streaming architectures and Server-Sent Events (SSE) for real-time AI responses
  • Understanding of AI safety, hallucination detection, and output validation techniques
  • Familiarity with AI evaluation frameworks and automated testing of LLM outputs

Mindset & Approach

  • AI-Native Thinking: You think in terms of probabilistic systems, understand LLM limitations, and know how to design robust systems around non-deterministic outputs.
  • Pragmatic Innovation: You balance cutting-edge AI capabilities with production requirements‚Äîknowing when to use simple solutions vs. complex AI architectures.
  • Ownership Mentality: You're proactive, resourceful, and accountable for your work‚Äîyou don't wait to be told what to do.
  • Team Player: You collaborate well with others, can explain AI concepts to non-technical stakeholders, and elevate those around you.
  • Quality-Focused: You understand the importance of evaluation, testing, and monitoring in AI systems and build with observability in mind.
  • Continuous Learner: You stay current with the rapidly evolving AI landscape, experiment with new models and techniques, and are energized by pushing the boundaries of what's possible.

Benefits

Compensation & How We Work

  • Competitive salary commensurate with experience (‚Ç¨80k-‚Ç¨110k+ depending on seniority)
  • On-site in Berlin-Mitte, with flexible remote work as you see fit (typically 3-4 days in office, flexible on specific days)
  • High autonomy, low politics, fast decision-making‚Äîwe value impact over process
  • Top-tier equipment‚Äîwhatever tools you need to do your best work

We're an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. If you're excited about the role but don't meet 100% of the criteria, we'd still love to hear from you‚Äîparticularly if you bring unique perspectives or experiences that would strengthen our team.

title: Staff Product Analyst, Rider Experience
description:
<gh-intro>
<text>
We are looking for an experienced Staff Product Analyst to join our RiderX product group and lead a team of analysts to help us scale and improve the experience of many millions of riders using our app globally.
</text>
</gh-intro>


<gh-about-us>
<title>About us</title>
<text>
With over 200 million customers in 50+ countries, Bolt is one of the fastest-growing tech companies in Europe and Africa. And it's all thanks to our people.  

We believe in creating an inclusive environment where everyone is welcome, regardless of race, colour, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, age, or disability.  

Our ultimate goal is to make cities for people, not cars, and we need your help to achieve this mission!
</text>
</gh-about-us>

<gh-responsibilities>

<bulletpoints>
‚Ä¢ <point>Leading and coaching a team of 2+ analysts to foster a culture of collaboration, innovation, and excellence to build a high-performing product analytics team.</point>

‚Ä¢ <point>Continuously developing your understanding of our marketplace, especially the demand side of it, and driving discovery of new opportunities to inform and steer the RiderX product strategy.</point>

‚Ä¢ <point>Identifying funnel optimisation opportunities, analysing user behaviour patterns and gathering feedback to enable actionable insights for product development.</point>

‚Ä¢ <point>Designing relevant and actionable metrics and owning A/B testing best practices to make better and faster product decisions.</point>

‚Ä¢ <point>Driving and contributing to the conceptualisation and development of analytical solutions, such as self-service data products or user segmentation.</point>

‚Ä¢ <point>Closely collaborating with your partners in Product Management, Engineering, Data Science, and other functions to drive forward cross-functional product and analytics initiatives and ensure seamless execution.</point>


</bulletpoints>
</gh-responsibilities>

 

<gh-requirements>

<bulletpoints>


‚Ä¢ <point>You hold a university degree in Economics, Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Information Management or similar studies.</point>
‚Ä¢ <point>You have 4+ years of experience working in Product Analytics and/or Data Science, including 1+ years of managerial experience.</point>
‚Ä¢ <point>You rank your SQL skills as "outstanding" & Python/R skills as "profound" and you have experience with BI tools and data visualisation.</point>
‚Ä¢ <point>You have strong business acumen, an entrepreneurial mindset and possess outstanding communication and leadership skills, with the ability to decompose complex solutions and insights into a clear narrative.</point>
‚Ä¢ <point>You have a solid understanding of end-to-end A/B testing, especially in user-based testing scenarios, and some experience with causal inference methods.</point>
‚Ä¢ <point>You have experience in consumer-facing analytics and a high interest in the bigger picture, the ability to understand, contribute to and steer product strategy.</point>
</bulletpoints>

<text>
Experience is great, but what we really look for is drive, intelligence, and integrity. So even if you don't tick every box, please consider applying!
</text>
</gh-requirements>
 
<gh-perks>
<title>Why you'll love it here:</title>
<bulletpoints>
  • <point>Accelerate your professional growth with unique career opportunities.</point>
  • <point>Enjoy a rewarding salary and stock options, knowing that as Bolt succeeds, so do you.</point>
  • <point>Take care of your physical and mental health with our wellness perks.</point>
  • <point>Celebrate 5 years at Bolt with a 1-month paid sabbatical to recharge.</point>
  • <point>Connect with colleagues at annual company events and smaller team gatherings.</point>
  • <point>Balance flexibility and in-person collaboration with our hybrid model, including at least 12 monthly in-office days.</point>
</bulletpoints>
<text>*Some perks may differ depending on your location and role.</text>
</gh-perks>

#LI-Hybrid

At Paintgun, creativity meets strategy to redefine what‚Äôs possible in digital advertising.

title: Performance Marketing Manager E-Commerce (m/w/d)
description:
Wir sind BonaTea.

Unsere Reise begann Ende 2021 in einer WG, aus der einfachen Not heraus, ein besonderes Tee-Geschenk f√ºr Fabi‚Äôs Mama zu finden. Heute sind wir ein schnell wachsendes Start-Up, welches den konservativen Tee-Markt aufmischt.

Wir lieben es, Dinge anzupacken, kreativ zu gestalten und direkt Ergebnisse zu sehen ‚Äì ohne lange Entscheidungswege oder starre Prozesse. Dabei stehen Eigeninitiative und Teamwork bei uns an erster Stelle. Auf Amazon geh√∂ren wir bereits zu den Topsellern ‚Äì jetzt steht der Relaunch unseres eigenen Online-Shops an. Daher suchen wir f√ºr unseren Online-Shop einen Performance Marketing Manager (m/w/d). Sei von Anfang an mit dabei und gestalte unseren n√§chsten gro√üen Wachstumsschritt aktiv mit.

Aufgaben

  • Meta-Ads Management: du setzt performance-getriebene Kampagnen um und entwickelst starke Werbeideen und Skripte f√ºr Video Ads
  • Google-Ads Management: du hebst unsere Google Ads auf das n√§chste Level

  • Strategische Weiterentwicklung: du beobachtest den Markt und identifizierst neue Potenziale zur Weiterentwicklung der Performance-Marketing-Aktivit√§ten
  • Ausarbeitung von Landing-Pages: um die Performance einzelner Kampagnen zu erh√∂hen, erstellst du mit unserem Kreativ-Team neue Landing-Pages
  • Shop-Optimierungen: Gemeinsam mit unserem Kreativ-Team optimierst du Produktdetailseiten und Landingpages, um die Performance unserer Kampagnen gezielt zu steigern.

Qualifikation

  • Abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich Wirtschaft, Marketing, E-Commerce oder einem vergleichbaren analytischen Fach.
  • Zahlenaffinit√§t sowie strukturelles & datengetriebenes Arbeiten mit Excel sind f√ºr dich selbstverst√§ndlich

  • Erste Ber√ºhrungspunkte mit Performance Marketing (z.‚ÄØB. Meta, Google, Amazon) ist ein Plus.
  • Sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse (mindestens C1-Niveau) in Wort und Schrift sind erforderlich.
  • Eigenverantwortliches Arbeiten und Lust in einem schnell wachsenden Startup richtig durchzustarten

title: Design Engineer (m/f/d) SolidWorks / Aircraft Structures
description:
AutoGyro GmbH is the global market leader in gyroplane manufacturing, headquartered in Hildesheim, Germany. With more than 3,000 aircraft delivered worldwide, AutoGyro stands for innovation, precision, and safety in light aviation.

We are now expanding our engineering team to strengthen our international design and production capability.

Purpose of the Role

As Design Engineer (m/f/d), you will take a key role in developing and maintaining a comprehensive 3D SolidWorks environment for AutoGyro‚Äôs aircraft models.

Your mission:

  • Build a complete set of SolidWorks models and drawings for all aircraft types.
  • Enable the creation of a 3D Illustrated Parts Catalogue (IPC).
  • Provide transferable design data and documentation for production facilities.

These models will form the technical foundation for the next generation of manufacturing process sheets and maintenance documentation.

Aufgaben

Design & Development

  • 3D design, modelling, and detailing of aircraft components and assemblies in SolidWorks (structures, fairings, cabin parts, mechanical systems).
  • Creation and revision of production drawings and Bills of Materials (BOMs) in line with CAA, CAAC, and FAA standards.
  • Integration of mechanical, composite, and electrical systems into the overall aircraft structure.
  • Establishment of assembly models and proper design requirements.
  • Cross-functional collaboration with Production, Quality, and Engineering teams.

Documentation & Certification Support

  • Preparation of engineering documentation, technical specifications, and test reports.
  • Support of design change and compliance documentation aligned with international aviation requirements.
  • Technical clarification with suppliers and certification partners.

Process & Continuous Improvement

  • Contribution to the development of new manufacturing process sheets and maintenance documentation.
  • Participation in design reviews and technical discussions.
  • Support the optimisation and standardisation of design and manufacturing processes.

Qualifikation

Education & Experience

  • Degree in Mechanical or Aerospace Engineering (or equivalent qualification).
  • Several years of practical design experience in mechanical or aerospace systems.
  • Proven SolidWorks expertise (mandatory).
  • Sound understanding of manufacturing processes (metal, composites, machining).
  • Experience within international aviation compliance environments (CAA, CAAC, FAA) is an advantage.

Working Style & Skills

  • Independent, structured, and proactive approach.
  • Strong coordination, analytical, and problem-solving abilities.
  • Attention to detail and high documentation accuracy.

Languages

  • Fluent in English and German (minimum C1 level, written and spoken, written-only or sub-C1 proficiency is not sufficient).

Benefits

  • Dynamic working environment with the global leader in gyroplane manufacturing.
  • Comprehensive onboarding and continuous training opportunities.
  • Supportive and international team culture.
  • Flexible working hours (flexitime) to support work‚Äìlife balance.
  • Corporate fitness programme (Hansefit).
  • Capital-forming benefits and above-average employer contributions to the pension scheme.
  • Employee discounts via our corporate benefits platform.
  • Regular company events that strengthen team spirit.
  • Free daily lunch at our headquarter.
  • Overtime compensation and additional paid leave for special occasions.
  • Unique aviation experience ‚Äì including a gyrocopter sightseeing flight.

Join the world leader in gyroplane innovation and shape the future of light aviation.

Apply now and become part of our passionate engineering team in Hildesheim!

title: Head of Safety and Systems Engineering
description:
ABOUT FUTURAIL

Futurail is a deeptech startup building the autonomy stack for self-driving trains. Our mission is to make rail the most attractive form of transport, by enabling frequent, reliable, low-carbon services powered by autonomous technology.

With our AI-based software stack, we help rail operators and manufacturers run safer and more efficient services, starting in depots and on branch lines, and expanding to mainline operations. Founded by experts in autonomous systems, we're rethinking how millions of people and goods move every day.

We‚Äôre backed by leading European investors and already working with mobility players across Europe and the US. As we enter our next phase of growth, this is your opportunity to join a high-trust, high-talent team that‚Äôs reshaping rail.

DESCRIPTION

As our Head of Safety and Systems Engineering based in our Munich, Lyon or Strasbourg office, you will be responsible for developing the safety case for our autonomous train technology, including safe obstacle detection, localization, and control. With no existing commercial rail-certified GoA4 systems in the market, you must tackle this challenge with a highly creative and forward-thinking mindset. This role requires you to revisit the core principles of safety, extract valuable insights from other industries, and seamlessly integrate them while navigating the unique constraints of the rail environment.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

JOB TASKS

  • Conduct standard safety steps of Risk Analysis, Fault Tree Analysis, Failure Mode and Effects Analysis, potentially with the help of external consultants
  • Elaborate a safety argumentation for an autonomy system running on an embedded platform using classical and later AI algorithms
  • Collaborate with engineers and architects to ensure that all failure modes are handled properly and that our software and hardware architecture meets our safety goals
  • Implement processes, methods and tools needed to develop SIL software
  • Write a railway safety case that will be accepted by Independent Safety Assessors and approval bodies like ERA, EPSF, EBA, and others
  • Promote a safety culture to all parts of our company

REQUIREMENTS

  • A minimum of 5 years of proven work experience with safety

  • Successful completion of homologation process of a software-heavy commercial product

  • Strong experience in either:

    • Perception algorithms and sensors such as LiDAR, camera, and radar, along with knowledge of computer specifications
    • Railway safety certification especially related to CENELEC 50716, 50126, 50128, 50129 norms

  • Analytic and structured working mode and good communication skills to explain our safety argumentation to internal engineers and external assessors

  • Fluent in English and at least one of French or German

  • Openness to learn, pragmatism, ambition and fun to work with

Join us as Head of Safety and Systems Engineering on our journey, and contribute to sustainable transportation for the future. If you are interested, please submit your application through this.

We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Product Analytics Manager, Rides Supply
description:
<gh-intro>
<text>

We are looking for an experienced Product Analytics Manager to join the Rides Supply team. You will help us scale and improve the experience of millions of drivers and thousands of fleet companies engaging on our ride-hailing marketplace across more than 50 countries.

</text>
</gh-intro>

 

<gh-about-us>
<title>About us</title>

<text>

With over 200 million customers in 50+ countries, Bolt is one of the fastest-growing tech companies in Europe and Africa. And it's all thanks to our people.

 

We believe in creating an inclusive environment where everyone is welcome, regardless of race, colour, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, or disability.

 

Our ultimate goal is to make cities for people, not cars, and we need your help to achieve this mission!

</text>

</gh-about-us>

<gh-role-detail>

<title>About the role</title>

<text>

In this role, you will be responsible for managing product analytics for both our product groups in the ride-hailing supply space: Driver Experience and Fleet Experience. The supply side in the ride-hailing marketplace includes private and fleet-employed drivers. While the Driver Experience group scales supply by enabling new and active drivers to earn a reliable source of income in a safe and trustworthy ecosystem, the Fleet Experience group scales supply by improving the experience of fleet companies.

As a Product Analytics Manager, you will be acting as a cross-functional partner to drive strategic decisions and solve high-impact business problems in our real-time marketplace. Working closely with product leadership, you will have a direct impact on scaling global supply for our largest product vertical ‚Äì Ridehailing.

Do you consider yourself both a hands-on product builder and systematic team enabler? If yes, join us as Product Analytics Manager and let us revolutionise ride-hailing!

 

</text>
</gh-role-detail>

<gh-responsibilities>

<title>Main tasks and responsibilities:</title>

<bulletpoints>

  • <point>Leading and developing a team of 5+ product analysts, fostering a culture of collaboration, innovation, and excellence to build a high-performing analytics team that stays ahead of industry standards.</point>
  • <point>Partnering with cross-functional counterparts in defining the vision and strategic goals for the rides supply groups, driving discovery efforts to uncover opportunities, ensure insights inform prioritisation and impactful product solutions.</point>
  • <point>Designing relevant and actionable metrics that measure and drive business success and owning A/B testing best practices to make better and faster product decisions.</point>
  • <point>Driving and contributing to the conceptualisation and development of analytical solutions, such as self-service data products or user segmentation.</point>
  • <point>Collaborating closely with partners in product management, engineering, design, operations and leadership stakeholders to drive forward cross-functional product and analytics initiatives and ensure seamless execution.</point>

</bulletpoints>
</gh-responsibilities>

 

<gh-requirements>

<title>About you:</title>

<bulletpoints>

  • <point>You have 6+ years of experience working in data analytics within product companies, including at least 2+ years in a managerial role with a track record of leading high-performing medium-sized teams.</point>
  • <point>You hold a university degree in Economics, Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Information Management or related fields.</point>
  • <point>You have strong business acumen, an entrepreneurial mindset and possess outstanding communication and leadership skills, with the ability to decompose complex solutions and insights into a clear narrative.</point>
  • <point>You have experience with consumer-facing analytics, including behavioural, funnel and cohort analysis, user segmentation or other applied methods
  • <point>You have hands-on experience and a fundamental understanding of designing, running and interpreting A/B tests, preferably some experience with other causal inference methods.</point>
  • <point>Preferably you have experience within fast-paced startup or scale up environments.</point>

</bulletpoints>
<text>

Experience is great, but we also look for drive, intelligence, and integrity. So, even if you don't tick every box, please consider applying if you feel you're the kind of person described above!
</text>
</gh-requirements>

<gh-perks>

<title>Why you'll love it here:</title>

<bulletpoints>

  • <point>Play a direct role in shaping the future of mobility.</point>
  • <point>Impact millions of customers and partners in 600+ cities across 50+ countries.</point>
  • <point>Work in fast-moving autonomous teams with some of the smartest people in the world. </point>
  • <point>Accelerate your professional growth with unique career opportunities.</point>
  • <point>Get a rewarding salary and stock option package that lets you focus on doing your best work.</point>
  • <point>Enjoy the flexibility of working in a hybrid mode with a minimum of 2 days in the office each week to foster strong connections and teamwork.</point>
  • <point>Take care of your physical and mental health with our wellness perks.</point>

</bulletpoints>
<text>*Some perks may differ depending on your location and role.</text>
</gh-perks>

title: Engineering Manager
description:
At SumUp, we are motivated by the purpose of levelling the playing field for small businesses. We empower small business owners by creating simple and affordable tools to manage payments, finance and customer relationships.

This is a high-impact engineering leadership role within our Lifecycle Tribe, focused on shaping and optimising some of the most critical customer touchpoints in the merchant journey,  from a merchant's first interaction on our website through to activation and beyond.

You'll lead cross-functional teams working on customer-facing platforms and digital experiences that sit at the core of how merchants discover, explore, and engage with SumUp. The work spans modern web architectures, scalability challenges, and data-informed decision-making to continuously improve quality and performance.

We're looking for a hands-on, technically credible leader who can drive delivery excellence, foster high engineering standards, and strengthen SumUp's ability to move fast while maintaining quality and reliability across our web and platform ecosystems.

 

What you'll do

  • Lead and Develop Teams: Lead, mentor, and grow high-performing  engineering squads and a shared Quality team, focused on delivering exceptional web and customer-facing experiences. You'll create a culture of trust, accountability, and continuous improvement where people can do their best work.
  • Drive Platform Evolution: Oversee ongoing modernization and transformation initiatives that enhance SumUp's web and digital capabilities, supporting flexibility, performance, and scalability.
  • Elevate Technical Excellence: Define and drive the technical direction for our web and purchase architectures, ensuring high standards for quality, observability, reliability, and maintainability.
  • Build a Data-Informed Culture: Introduce and operationalise measurement frameworks for engineering effectiveness, using metrics (such as DORA) to identify friction points, improve throughput, and guide performance discussions.
  • Champion Performance: Manage engineering performance with clarity and empathy. This includes setting clear expectations, creating development plans, mentoring talent, and managing underperformance constructively.
  • Collaborate and Align: Build high-trust, effective collaboration with cross-functional partners, including Product, Marketing, Design, and Platform teams, to align on roadmaps and enhance delivery predictability.

What we're looking for

  • Experience: 8-12 years of software engineering experience, with 3+ years managing multiple engineering squads or teams.
  • Technical Depth: Strong technical background in modern web technologies and architecture, including Go, React, Next.js, Typescript, microservices, and APIs.
  • Migration Leadership: Demonstrated success leading large-scale migration projects or complex technical transformations.
  • Operational Excellence: Proven experience in driving engineering and operational excellence, including on-call processes, observability, testing, and CI/CD.
  • People Leadership: A track record of developing, mentoring, and managing engineers and tech leads, maintaining a high bar for performance and collaboration.
  • Communication: Exceptional communication and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to build alignment across both technical and non-technical domains.
  • Mindset: A strategic yet hands-on leader who thrives in ambiguity, acts with ownership, and balances innovation with disciplined execution.

Bonus Points

  • Direct experience with CMS platforms (like Builder.io or Contentful) and managing web infrastructure at scale.
  • Background in Growth, Lifecycle, or e-commerce domains.
  • Understanding of SEO, personalisation, and experimentation frameworks.

 

Why you should join SumUp

 

  • Opportunity to work with a truly global, multicultural team from our central Covent Garden location, wrapped in historic charm and modern flair. This involves an office-first setup
  • Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion: be part of a workplace that values and promotes diversity, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone's perspectives are respected and embraced
  • Enrolment onto our VSOP program: you will own a stake in SumUp's future success
  • Generous time off: enjoy 28 days of paid leave plus public holidays and special leave days
  • Numerous other benefits such as Urban Sports Club subsidy, Kita placement assistance, subsidised office lunches
  • Break4me: 1-month sabbatical after 3 years of service
  • Referral Bonus: earn additional rewards by referring talented individuals to join the SumUp team

Job Application Tip

We recognise that candidates feel they need to meet 100% of the job criteria in order to apply for a job. Please note that this is only a guide. If you don't tick every box, it's ok too because it means you have room to learn and develop your career at SumUp.

title: Sales Specialist - German and French Speakers
description:
Join us at Ventura TRAVEL ‚Äì a group of specialized travel brands that unleash the adventurer in every person!

Are you energized by connecting with people and guiding them toward their dream adventure? As a Sales Specialist at Ventura TRAVEL, you'll be on the front lines of helping travelers choose and book life-changing trips. If you love meaningful conversations, enjoy achieving results, and want to grow your sales expertise in an international environment, this role is for you. At Ventura TRAVEL, we offer authentic, interactive, and innovative travel experiences. We truly want our travelers to soak in the enriching culture and stunning beauty of the country while engaging in fun group activities with the locals. Come join us and be a part of something truly special!

Ventura TRAVEL was ranked #14 in the list of Germany's Best Employers 2024 by ZEIT (a leading national newspaper) and Kununu (Germany's top employer review platform), out of thousands of rated companies.
Read more here (in German).

On daily basis, you will 

  • Respond to travel inquiries and guide customers through the booking process.
  • Achieve monthly and quarterly sales goals.
  • Follow up with potential travelers quickly and thoroughly.
  • Use our tools and templates to create travel offers and handle requests efficiently.
  • Communicate with travelers by email and phone in a helpful and friendly manner.
  • Use AI tools to save time and improve how you work.
  • Share ideas and insights with the rest of the team.
  • Stay informed about our destinations so you can answer questions confidently.

The basics you bring along 

  • At least 2 years of sales experience with strong and proven results.
  • You enjoy helping people make decisions and are motivated by goals.
  • You stay calm and focused, even on busy days.
  • You use digital tools to work smarter, not harder ‚Äì and are open to new ones.
  • You're a team player and communicate clearly and respectfully.
  • You speak and write either German or French fluently, and are confident in English as well.
  • You are flexible to travel at least once or twice a year.
  • You are available to work 8 hours per day between 8AM and 8PM, Central European Time (CET).

You can impress us even more with

  • Experience in the travel industry.
  • Familiarity with digital tools like CRMs or booking platforms.
  • Experience working with different types of clients.

What we promise you

  • Freedom to be creative in achieving results.
  • International & friendly working environment.
  • Quarterly Social Days and Team Events.
  • Work out of other offices in the Ventura network around the world.
  • Opportunity to constantly learn and grow.
  • We care about the well-being of your employees (regular O3, satisfaction surveys etc.)
  • Yearly 2-week offsite.
  • Participation in the overall company's profits.
  • Visit our Career Page to get more insights into our office life.

Confidentiality & Diversity 

Applications at Ventura TRAVEL are treated with strict confidentiality. We use a professional HR-Software that only grants access to your applications to HR, the Recruiting Manager, and the interviewers. 

It is our commitment that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion.

title: Manager, Finance & Strategy, Germany
description:
About Wolt

At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we're building the delivery of (almost) everything and you'll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.

Working at Wolt isn't always easy, but it's definitely exciting. Here you'll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You'll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you're a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.

We are looking for a Manager, Finance & Strategy to support our Germany business. You will be the strategic advisor to important partners across our Germany business to ensure we are making the most efficient investment and capital allocation decisions while improving the experience for all of our marketplace participants. You will lead financial reporting, forecasting, and planning, and will guide financial insights and direction for all of our operational decisions and strategies. 

You will report to the Director, Finance & Strategy. We expect this role to be hybrid with some time in-office in Berlin and some time remote.

What you'll be doing

  • Own the P&L, with a deep understanding of the key drivers to strategically balance growth and profitability
  • Lead weekly financial reporting and forecasting, as well as quarterly planning, acting as the go-to expert on business performance
  • Identify and evaluate key risks and opportunities, build business cases and investment proposals, and ensure effective execution of strategic initiatives
  • Build detailed, scalable forecasting models for the country
  • Own visibility into actuals: analysis, reporting, and insights for leadership
  • Partner with business leaders to create annual plans, forecasts, and business cases
  • Identify, recommend, and track optimization opportunities
  • Develop tools and reporting to automate and scale revenue and expense management
  • Drive ad-hoc financial analyses and special projects

Our humble expectations

  • 6+ years of experience in FP&A, Strategic Finance, or a related field
  • Strong track record building financial models, managing budgets and forecasts
  • Highly proficient in Excel and/or Google Sheets; bonus for Looker, Power BI (Power Query) skills
  • Strong analytical skills; able to move between the big picture and drill into the
  • details
  • Proven experience partnering cross-functionally with business leaders
  • Ownership mindset and ability to work independently
  • Experience in high-growth, fast-paced environments preferred
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills
  • Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, or a related field

If you're interested in this position and meet the qualifications listed above, we encourage you to apply today!

What you'll get by joining us

  • Opportunity to be part of building something exceptional, in an international environment
  • Lots of learning and growth in a globally scaling tech company

Please note that we do not accept applications sent by mail. You should submit your application through our careers website!

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

We're committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That's why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: Senior Software Engineer (Odoo / ERP) (m/w/d) - Remote
description:
Your responsibilities

At AlphaPet Ventures, we are driven by the vision of making healthy pet food the new standard.
To further professionalize our digital processes and make our e-commerce platforms future-proof, we are looking for an experienced Senior Software Engineer to play a key role in shaping the architecture and development of our central Odoo-based ERP system ‚Äî and to drive innovation through the use of AI.

  • Design and develop sophisticated solutions for our Odoo-based ERP system, optimize existing modules, and ensure their stability, efficiency, and scalability
  • Implement strategic ERP projects, evaluate the technical feasibility of requirements from tickets, and collaborate closely with Product Owners
  • Manage the entire release process, handle branch management (Git), monitor the CI/CD pipeline, and communicate releases to all stakeholders
  • Write clean, maintainable code, ensure quality through comprehensive testing, and promote high standards in the team through code reviews
  • Proactively identify opportunities for process automation and apply your knowledge of AI tools to optimize our development and business processes

Your profile

  • At least 5 years of professional experience in software development, ideally with a focus on backend or ERP systems
  • Solid, hands-on experience in developing with Odoo and the OCA framework is essential
  • Proven experience in using AI tools for process optimization, code review, or system improvement
  • Excellent knowledge of Python and PostgreSQL, and confident handling of Git, Docker, and CI/CD pipelines
  • Strong commitment to sustainable software architecture, clean code, and a solution-oriented mindset
  • Fluent in English; German language skills are a plus

What we offer

  • Responsible, exciting, and varied tasks with plenty of creative freedom in a dynamic company that values flat hierarchies and an open, informal work culture where everyone is on a first-name basis
  • A friendly, open team of around 340 employees located in Munich, Leipzig, and Albourne (UK) ‚Äî plus several lovely office dogs at our sites
  • Flexible working hours based on trust, home-office options including financial support for your equipment, and the possibility to work abroad for several months
  • 28 days of paid vacation, plus up to 20 additional unpaid leave days and special leave options
  • Various internal and external training opportunities you can choose according to your interests
  • Attractive employee discounts ‚Äî for both humans and pets!
  • Regular team, company, and family & friends events
  • Need a break? Relax in our social area equipped with a foosball table, or challenge your colleagues to a Mario Kart match (or another Nintendo Switch game) on our comfy lounge sofa!
  • Don‚Äôt like reheated meals? Don‚Äôt want to wait for delivery? Use our fully equipped, high-quality office kitchen to cook your own meals or bake something delicious!
  • Enjoy free coffee, cocoa, tea, and a variety of cold drinks (water, juices, soft drinks), as well as fresh fruit, snacks, and a fully stocked candy drawer
  • Many more great benefits that we‚Äôll be happy to share with you during the recruitment process!

Interested ?

We look forward to receiving your application ‚Äî including your cover letter, CV, your earliest possible start date, and your salary expectations.

description:

As Product Owner (m/f/x) you will be responsible for driving the evolution of YOC‚Äôs internal and client-facing digital systems - from our CRM and customer portal to the automation of workflows between our key business platforms (HubSpot, Monday.com, YOC Billing & Reporting Services).

Your goal: to streamline processes, ensure data quality and create scalable, efficient systems that empower our commercial teams and enhance the advertiser experience.

Your responsibilities will include:

  • Collecting and structuring business requirements into clear, actionable work packages for the development teams.
  • Managing the product backlog, prioritizing features based on business impact and technical feasibility.
  • Translating sales, creative production and campaign delivery processes into automated, data-driven workflows.
  • Monitoring performance and data consistency across interconnected systems (HubSpot, Monday.com, YOC Hub, etc.).
  • Using analytics to evaluate product performance, measure success, and support decision-making.
  • Collaborating with fellow product specislists to ensure smooth integration between the company‚Äôs platforms.

  • Supporting stakeholders with workshops, onboarding, and adoption of new tools and features.

YOUR PROFILE

  • Experience: 2‚Äì4 years as a Product Owner (m/f/x), Business Analyst (m/f/x) or Product Manager (m/f/x) in a digital or SaaS company.

WHAT WE OFFER

to implement your ideas independently. It is our goal to support you in your personal and professional development, and together, to continue our pioneering work in the future-driven mobile advertising market.

In doing so, we are laying the foundation for a digital, future-ready, and resilient education ecosystem.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
GROPYUS creates sustainable, affordable, and aspirational buildings for everyone through modular construction and setting a new standard in smart living.

You will be part of a highly collaborative product team working at the core of our manufacturing facility, transforming digital models into physical elements at scale.
As a Senior Software Engineer, you will be part of a team responsible for integrating and coordinating the PLC, Robot, and 3rd-party systems which manufacture wall and slab elements. You will write software ‚Äì both alone as well as in pair with your team colleagues, ensure functionality with a solid testing approach and deploy and rollout changes to the live systems. Furthermore, our teams are also responsible for operating and troubleshooting the software they have developed during working hours at the factory.

Tasks

As a Senior Software Engineer (f/m/d) on the Product Delivery team, you will be responsible for:

  • Designing, building, testing and operating software solutions for logistics and manufacturing use cases incl. Robots, AGVs and other (semi) automated manufacturing equipment.
  • Working in a hybrid infrastructure environment (cloud and on-prem), managing complex software deployments at scale
  • Bringing a software operations mindset to monitor, maintain, and improve software uptime including reliable updates, latency, and efficiency
  • Applying and building upon your experience in PLC or robot programming to help the team move the existing solutions to a full and flexible Software Defined Manufacturing process
  • Acting as a bridge between digital product delivery & physical logistics and manufacturing systems, ensuring both are aligned and integrated
  • Helping define, monitor and evolve SLAs/SLOs as well as other important KPIs like e.g. OEE for critical systems

Requirements

  • You are an experienced software engineer‚Äì preferably with a background in manufacturing or logistics systems, PLC or robot programming or software system operations in a smart factory

  • You possess practical experience in some / all key areas of modern software development, including infrastructure, observability, testing, deployment pipelines incl. quality assurance, and scaling

  • You have operated and supported large-scale software systems in cloud and non-cloud environments (on-premise) or PLC and robot systems in a manufacturing or logistics facility

  • You have worked in companies with strong operational cultures, ideally in logistics or manufacturing ‚Äì understanding the commercial impact of system downtime

  • You are proficient with most of the following technologies:

  • Kotlin / SpringBoot

  • Kubernetes

  • Linux

  • PostgreSQL

  • Python / Bash is a plus

  • OPC-UA / PLC (e.g. TIA) / robot programming (e.g. KRL)

  • You bring Cloud Operations experience

  • Experience with Azure is a bonus

  • You are familiar with monitoring and alerting practices for production systems

  • You have experience defining and working with SLAs/SLOs

  • You are willing to travel to our manufacturing site in Richen whenever needed and within Germany and Austria for in-person team events

Benefits

  • An unlimited contract with 30 vacation days.
  • Flexible, hybrid work: You can work from home or come into the office on the schedule that works best for you. Feel like traveling and working from another location? No problem. Tune into meetings and work from abroad for up to 40 days per year. In addition, flex hours allow you to prioritize important moments in your day.
  • Attractive perks and benefits: We offer a company pension scheme, language courses (English/German), and employee discounts with selected sustainable brands. Furthermore, our external partners in mental health support you in strengthening your mental health through anonymous private/group sessions.
  • Virtual Shares Program: Participate in the success of GROPYUS through our Virtual Share Program.
  • Ownership: You can truly make your mark with your work and contributions ‚Äì on all our organizational levels. Find your solutions, drive and test them.
  • The chance to be part of something big: Our mission is to rethink an entire industry. Join us in reinventing construction and fostering sustainable, affordable living.
  • A diverse and enriching work environment: Become a valued member of a wonderfully diverse team of individuals from over 50 countries. At GROPYUS we value inclusion above all, ensuring that everyone feels they belong ‚Äì no matter their background. In this way, our differences become strengths that help us grow as a team.

Join us on our mission to design buildings as continuously evolving products to create the most exciting and affordable experience for all. We build for people and conserve the resources of our planet.

We can't wait to get to know you.
For more information, visit our website, and if you have any questions, please reach out to us via Find Jobs in Germany on Arbeitnow

Stellenanforderungen

  • Profi in Make oder Zapier (APIs, Webhooks, Error-Handling, Versionierung).
  • 3‚Äì5+ Jahre RevOps/CRM/Automation (idealerweise Coaching/Finance/Immo).

title: Working Student - Quality Assurance (f/m/d)
description:
adjoe is a leading mobile ad platform developing cutting-edge advertising and monetization solutions that take its app partners‚Äô business to the next level. Our unique ad unit Playtime has made us one of the fastest-growing ad platforms and top-ranking user acquisition sources for app publishers worldwide (ranked #1 for growth in the AppsFlyer Index). And that‚Äôs just the start: We‚Äôve just launched our programmatic in-app platform in order to disrupt the status quo of mobile ad monetization. Again.

Home to an advanced tech stack, powerful financial backing from Bertelsmann, and a long-term growth mindset, adjoe is part of the AppLike Group ecosystem. A hub of disruption and thought leadership in the app economy, with a driven and dynamic workforce to be reckoned with. Be the next tech-driven, ambitious talent to join our growing teams!

Meet your Team: Rewarded Solutions

Our Rewarded Solutions team develops the technology behind adjoe's innovative rewarded engagement products that serve over 57 million daily mobile users.

The team‚Äôs tech stack consists of three major components: native Android and iOS SDKs written in Java/Kotlin and Swift handling complex engagement flows; widely customizable offerwall applications built with React TypeScript; and a highly performant Golang backend hosted on AWS that processes millions of events hourly. Our system matches each game with its ideal users, delivering rewards optimized for satisfaction through data processed via AWS Athena, Kafka, Spark, S3, and MySQL.

For team members, this means having state-of-the-art resources to build engaging rewarded ad experiences that seamlessly integrate into the world‚Äôs top apps while delivering exceptional results for advertisers and monetizers in this industry-leading technology.

As a Working Student - Quality Assurance, you will support our team in ensuring that the solutions we deliver meet their intended purpose. You will help verify requirements, assist in finding and tracking bugs, and contribute to validating documentation for new features. This is a perfect opportunity to gain hands-on experience in software testing and see how modern software products are built and maintained.

What You Will Do:

  • Support Manual Testing: Assist the team by manually testing new application features (for both mobile and web) following existing test plans and checklists.
  • Bug Reporting: Learn how to clearly and effectively identify, document, and report bugs you discover using our bug-tracking tools.
  • Learn Test Automation: Get exposure to our test automation frameworks. You will start by helping to modify and update existing automated tests under the guidance of senior engineers.
  • Documentation: Help review and verify user guides and other relevant documents to ensure new features are clear and understandable.
  • Communicate & Collaborate: Work closely with developers and other QA team members to understand requirements and report your findings.
  • Test Management: Use our test management tools to execute test cases and track your results.
  • Learn the Domain: Actively learn about our products and business to understand what you are testing and why it matters.

Who You Are:

  • Education: You are currently enrolled as a student (Bachelor's or Master's) in Computer Science, Business Informatics, or a similar technical field.
  • Mindset: You have a curious and analytical mindset with a natural talent for finding issues. You have a strong attention to detail and a passion for quality.
  • Technical Interest: You have a basic understanding of how software is built (perhaps from university projects) and are eager to learn about testing web applications, mobile apps (Android/iOS), and APIs.
  • Experience: No prior professional experience is required! Any experience from internships, personal projects, or university courses related to software development or testing is a big plus.
  • Communication: You have good verbal and written communication skills in English (our team language).
  • Organisation: You are reliable, self-organized, and able to manage your tasks alongside your university studies.
  • Nice to have: You have a general knowledge of test case writing.
  • Nice to have: You have experience in using Jira and Testmo.

Fuel for the Journey: Benefits to Support Your Ambitions

  • Live Your Best Life, at Work and Beyond: We work in a hybrid setup with 3 core office days, plus flexible working hours. Enjoy a lot of vacation days, hybrid work model, free access to an in-house gym with lots of different fitness classes and mental health support through our Employee Assistance Program (EAP), and many other benefits!
  • Thrive Where You Work: Enjoy the Alster Lake view from our central office with top-notch equipment, fun open spaces, and a large variety of snacks and drinks.
  • Join the Community! Participate in regular team and company events, including hackathons and social gatherings. We work together, and we celebrate together, too.

Skip writing cover letters. Tell us about your most passionate personal project, your desired salary and your earliest possible start date. We are looking forward to your application!

We welcome applications from people who will contribute to the diversity of our company.

title: Global Brand Design Manager (m/f/x)
description:
Atolls is the world's largest community-driven shopping platform, active in 20+ markets. 

We help millions make smarter spending decisions across discovery, evaluation, and (re-)purchase by connecting people with the right brands and retailers.

Our 1,000+ team across 10 countries builds products used every day at global scale, where you'll have real ownership and see your impact. Want to shape the destinations people rely on to shop with confidence? Keep reading.

About This Role:

We're looking for a Global Brand Design Manager (m/f/d) to join our Design organization and lead the evolution of Atolls' brands, including Mydealz, Dealabs, Hotukdeals, Pepper, Shoop, iGraal, and other brands across our multiple markets.

This role is ideal for a systems-minded creative leader passionate about design scalability, craft excellence, and cross-functional collaboration. You'll define and scale our global brand's visual identity across products, campaigns, and experiences, ensuring cohesive, high-quality design that connects users and partners worldwide.

You'll champion AI, automation, and process-driven design, partnering closely with product, marketing, commercial, and editorial teams to align on a unified global roadmap that maximizes the brand's reach, impact, and creative potential.

Our Benefits:

At Atolls, we believe in nurturing both your professional and personal growth. Here's what you can expect:

    ‚Ä¢    A culture that values personal and professional development, with internal mobility opportunities.
    ‚Ä¢    A supportive and open-minded team that embraces diverse perspectives and innovative ideas.
    ‚Ä¢    32 days of paid vacation plus your birthday off, giving you the time you need to recharge.
    ‚Ä¢    A flexible hybrid working scheme to balance work and life.
    ‚Ä¢    Access to a learning budget and internal training to help you grow in your role.
    ‚Ä¢    Mental health coaching to support your well-being.
    ‚Ä¢    Regular global and local get-togethers to celebrate successes and build connections.
    ‚Ä¢    The possibility of taking a sabbatical after two years with the company.
    ‚Ä¢    A cloud-based company setup, providing flexibility and collaboration opportunities no matter where you are.

*These are global benefits that apply to all employees, with additional local perks based on your location.

Responsibilities:

  • Lead and evolve the global brand identity system, scaling the use of our logo, color palette, typography, iconography, imagery, and motion design to ensure cohesive storytelling across all touchpoints.
  • Develop scalable systems, toolkits, and workflows that maintain global consistency while allowing regional flexibility. Define and uphold design principles that drive creative excellence and innovation.
  • Leverage AI and automation to streamline production, improve efficiency, and raise the quality bar at scale.
  • Partner with marketing, product, and design system teams to integrate the brand seamlessly across product, campaign, and experiential environments. Define and drive the global brand design roadmap in collaboration with marketing, product, commercial, and editorial partners, ensuring unified priorities and long-term strategic alignment.
  • Foster a culture of openness, critique, and collaboration‚Äîmentoring senior designers and leading creative reviews that strengthen global design quality.
  • Own the delivery of global brand initiatives from concept to execution, translating strategy into scalable outcomes with measurable impact. 

 Your Profile:

  • 4+ years of experience in Brand Design Leadership at scale.
  • Proven success defining and evolving global visual identity systems across multiple markets and channels.
  • Deep expertise in brand systems, typography, color, motion design, and visual storytelling.
  • Strong proficiency in design tools and systems, for instance, Figma, Adobe, and others.
  • Experience integrating AI and automation into creative workflows.
  • Exceptional communication, storytelling, and stakeholder management skills.
  • A collaborative, growth-oriented mindset‚Äîleading with empathy, clarity, and accountability.

Our hiring process:

  1. TA Call: Meet one of our Talent Experts and get to know Atolls better.
  2. Technical Round: Focus on the technical aspects of the role, and meet your potential manager.
  3. Final Round: Meet other Atollians üèùÔ∏è
    It varies from 1 to 3 interviews

*Some processes might slightly change according to needs

Ready to apply?

Be part of a destination where your work helps millions of people make better decisions every day. One focused application is all we need. If you truly fit more than one role, you're welcome to apply to up to three. This helps us match you with the right opportunity faster.

We review every application with equal care and will reach out if your profile aligns. Apply now with your CV in English.
